https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/walter-cronkite-dies-at-age-92-2009177/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/walter-cronkite-dies-at-age-92-2009177/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/walter-cronkite-dies-at-age-92-2009177/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Walter Cronkite Dies At Age 92", "datePublished": "2009-07-17T21:31:01-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:56-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The legendary newsman passed away Friday night in New York", "articleBody": "Legendary broadcasting icon Walter Cronkite, the trusted news anchor who chronicled many of the most important events of the last century, has died at age 92.\r\nThe former CBS news anchorman, whose calm, paternal demeanor and authoritative delivery of the news set the standard for decades, had been in failing health. The cause of death was cerebral vascular disease.  He leaves behind three children, Nancy and Kathy, son Walter III, and four grandchildren. His wife of 64 years, Betsy, died in 2005.  Dubbed &quot;the most trusted man in America&quot; for his unflappability during some of the most tumultuous and exciting moments of the 20th Century, Cronkite was also affectionately known to generations of TV watchers as &quot;Uncle Walter&quot; during his tenure as anchorman for the CBS Evening News from 1962-1981.  Born on November 4, 1916 in St. Joseph, MO., Walter Leland Cronkite Jr&apos;s destiny was forged from an early age after reading an article about the adventurous world of reporters in a boys&apos; magazine.  Kicking off his journalistic career on his high school newspaper, Cronkite&apos;s first job was as a part-time reporter at the Houston Post in the 1930s.  In 1939, Cronkite traveled to Europe as a war correspondent for the United Press, where he made his name covering some of the most important events of the time including the Battle of the Bulge, the D-Day invasion and the Nuremberg Trials.  Hired by CBS&apos;s Edward R. Murrow in 1950, Cronkite earned the respect of Americans for his breaking of the assassination of President John F. Kennedy in 1963.  His subsequent coverage of the American moon landing in 1969 further cemented his status as one of America&apos;s most respected and trusted voices.  Cronkite retired in 1981 and handed over the reigns of the newscast to Dan Rather but remained a presence in Americans lives as an elder statesman and living legend of broadcasting.", "isPartOf": 1985 classic The Breakfast Club and 1986&apos;s Pretty in Pink, admits that she&apos;ll &quot;always be the girl whose 16th birthday is forgotten&quot; thanks to her breakout role in Candles. But she didn&apos;t always feel that way.  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have gone too soon\n &quot;John saw something in me that I didn&apos;t even see in myself,&quot; she writes in Wednesday&apos;s New York Times. &quot;Eventually, though, I felt that I needed to work with other people as well. I wanted to grow up, something I felt (rightly or wrongly) I couldn&apos;t do while working with John.&quot;  \nRemember the stars who passed away last year\nDeclining roles in Hughes&apos; subsequent projects created friction, she says.  (&quot;Sometimes I wonder if that was what he found so unforgivable,&quot; she writes, adding that he held grudges that &quot;were almost supernatural things.&quot;) As a result, she says she and Hughes -- who died of a heart attack on Aug. 6 -- didn&apos;t talk for &quot;more than 20 years.&quot;   \nSee what some of your favorite &apos;80s stars are up to now\nBut 15 years ago, she wrote and told him  &quot;how important he was to me.&quot;\n&quot;A week after I sent my letter, I received a bouquet of flowers as big as my apartment from John, thanking me for writing,&quot; says Ringwald, who now stars on ABC Family&apos;s The Secret Life of the American Teenager. &quot;I was so relieved to know that I had gotten through to him, and I feel grateful now for that sense of never gets old, he said, &quot;No, it never gets old - I am here to testify.&quot; The actor also called Jolie &quot;amazing ... a fantastic mother.&quot; \nSee Angelina Jolie&apos;s baby photo.\nLike Jolie, he declined to answer a question about how the actress has changed him. &quot;I don&apos;t want to get into it,&quot; he said. &quot;We&apos;re happy to be here.&quot; Both are nominated for https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/michael-jacksons-public-memorial-to-be-held-tuesday-200937/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/michael-jacksons-public-memorial-to-be-held-tuesday-200937/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/michael-jacksons-public-memorial-to-be-held-tuesday-200937/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Michael Jackson&#8217;s Public Memorial to Be Held Tuesday", "datePublished": "2009-07-03T14:30:57-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:27-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The family makes 17,500 tickets available to fans via online lottery", "articleBody": "Fans will get a chance to say goodbye to Michael Jackson at a public memorial service to be held at L.A.&apos;s Staples Center on Tuesday, a spokesman for the singer&apos;s family confirmed.\n&quot;The memorial has to do with accommodating as many fans as possible,&quot; spokesman Ken Sunshine said at a press conference announcing plans for the service in Los Angeles Friday.   Tim Leiweke, the CEO of AEG Live, which owns the Staples Center, announced that 17,500 tickets will be made available to fans via an Internet lottery at the venue&apos;s Web site. Online registration -- which does not guarantee a ticket for the memorial service -- concludes Saturday, July 4 at 6 p.m. PST. As of 9 a.m. PST Saturday, the Web site had received 1,223,978 ticket registrations.\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nTuesday&apos;s service, celebrating the life of The King of Pop, will take place at the same venue (capacity: 20,000) where Jackson rehearsed for his London concert tour just two days before he died on June 25 at age 50.   A simulcast of the memorial service will occur at the Nokia Theater across the street. Randomly selected ticketholders notified on Sunday, July 5 will receive wristbands for one location or the other. The remaining tickets are set aside for the Jackson family to allocate as they see fit.   \nRevisit Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\n No other details of the memorial were made available, though officials confirmed there would be no funeral procession, in an effort to maintain crowd control.  On Thursday, Jackson&apos;s brother, Jermaine, told CNN&apos;s Larry King the public&apos;s safety was paramount when it came to making plans for the memorial.\nSee photos of the singer and his children\n&quot;The hardest thing is, where do you rest Michael Jackson?&quot; he said in an interview at Neverland Ranch. &quot;Everything [Michael] did was so over the top, and there are people coming from all over the world in groups of 20s and hundreds of thousands.  &quot;We worked with the city authorities and they&apos;re trying their best,&quot; he continued. &quot;And with the time frame we have, we&apos;re hoping that everybody is safe and things are going to be locked down pretty much.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Says the editor in chief: &quot;The editing didn&apos;t take long. I changed two words for grammatical reasons and added a comma or two.&quot;\nSee pics of first children through the years\nAn excerpt from the message, which runs this on Father&apos;s Day this Sunday, is below:  &quot;I observe this Father&apos;s Day not just as a father grateful to be present in my daughters&apos; lives but also as a son who grew up without a father in my own life.   \nSee the Obama family album\n&quot;In many ways, I came to understand the importance of fatherhood through its absence--both in my life and in the lives of others. I came to understand that the hole a man leaves when he abandons his responsibility to his children is one that no government can fill. We can do everything possible to provide good jobs and good schools and safe streets for our kids, but it will never be enough to fully make up the difference.\nCheck out star dads&apos; personal kid photos\n&quot;We need fathers to step up, to realize that their job does not end at conception; that what makes you a man is not the ability to have a child but the courage to raise one.\n&quot;I know I have been an imperfect father. I know I have made mistakes. I have lost count of all the times, over the years, when the demands of work have taken me from the duties of fatherhood. There were many days out on the campaign trail when I felt like my family was a million miles away, and I knew I was missing moments of my daughters&apos; lives that I&apos;d never get back. It is a loss I will never fully accept.  \nLook back at the Obama family&apos;s first 100 days in the White House\n&quot;On this Father&apos;s Day, I think about the pledge I made to Malia the day she The bleeding created a sac of blood that caused pressure and pain, he continued.  The actress, 62, revealed she had anal cancer in 2006. The following year, she held a press conference to announce she was in remission, but her cancer returned shortly after.\r\nSee photos of stars who beat cancer. The recent operation was related to the spread of cancer to the liver, her doctor added.   Despite reports on RadarOnline.com that she was unconscious, her doctor told Reuters: &quot;She remains in good spirits with her usual sense of humor...If everything goes as we hope, we plan to discharge her later in the week.&quot;  Her longtime boyfriend Ryan O&apos;Neal asked fans to &quot;pray for her&quot; but said, &quot;this is not at death&apos;s door.&quot;  Fawcett&apos;s unconventional treatments she&apos;s receiving in Germany will be broadcast in an NBC documentary, A Wing and a Prayer.\r\nSee the day&apos;s top news photos.\r\n&quot;It&apos;s never had anything to do with stem cells,&quot; or alternative treatments like shark cartilage, coffee enemas or unproven &quot;detoxification&quot; diets, the documentary&apos;s producer Craig Nevius said.  &quot;It&apos;s much more scientific than that. It&apos;s not a fringe treatment,&quot; he said, and the doctors have &quot;multiple, multiple degrees.&quot;  In an earlier statement, Nevius said Fawcett was grateful to &quot;her fans, who have offered their constant support throughout her fight, as well as out of concern for the countless of other cancer patients who have written to her to say that they are following her story in the hope that there is hope.&quot;  Meanwhile, her troubled 24-year-old son Redmond O&apos;Neal was arrested on suspicion of bringing narcotics into a jail facility after admitting he was carrying drugs, L.A. Sheriff&apos;s spokesman Steve Whitmore confirms. He is being held on $25,000 bail.\r\nSee photos of star mug shots.\r\nRedmond and his father Ryan were arrested last September on suspicion of meth possession after police raided their Malibu home. I&apos;ve been able to surround myself professionally with a ton of great people and that&apos;s from my management, my label, all the way down to my fans.&quot;  &quot;The condolences and well wishes sent my way in the last month-and-a-half have been unreal,&quot; he said.\r\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars gone too soon\r\nAt age 26, Adam was diagnosed with brain cancer. And, throughout his battle, Cook said Adam &quot;was defiant almost to a fault.&quot;  &quot;The doctors, when they first diagnosed him, gave him about two years. And every time they would give him a diagnosis of a definite amount of time, he would always seem to exceed it,&quot;  he said. &quot;And I remember I took a couple of days off from this tour that we&apos;d been on back in March because we got bad news that it was going to be a few days at best and then, of course, he lasted seven more weeks.&quot;\r\nAdam succumbed to the disease May 2 at age 37.  Cook learned of his brother&apos;s passing while he was in Washington, D.C. for the Race for Hope, a fundraiser for brain cancer research.   &quot;I would say the actual event was unexpected, but we kind of knew for a while that Adam was heading in that direction,&quot; Cook said. &quot;Now that it&apos;s done and it&apos;s over with, it gives us a chance as a family to kind of regroup and move on and, hopefully, make sure that, you know, his memory just kind of lives on.&quot;\r\nSee where your favorite American Idol contestants are now\r\nCook remembers his brother -- who is survived by wife Kendra and their two children -- as &quot;amazing, definitely one of my best friends, one of my biggest advisers.&quot;  Added Cook, &quot;He was important to everybody that knew him, which is very cool.&quot;\r\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\r\nCook said his brother &quot;maintained his sense of humor all the way to the end. Coroner&#8217;s Office: Michael Jackson Autopsy Report Inaccurate", "datePublished": "2009-06-29T08:54:14-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:14-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "A leaked autopsy also reveals that the singer only had pills in his stomach when he passed", "articleBody": "The Los Angeles coroner&apos;s office on Monday dismissed as inaccurate a British newspaper report that said Michael Jackson was emaciated and almost bald when he died suddenly last week.  \nJackson, who died June 25 after suffering cardiac arrest at the age 50, weighed just 112 pounds, was bald and badly disfigured at the time of his death, according to leaked results from an autopsy.\nBritain&apos;s The Sun obtained a copy of the report, which claimed Jackson&apos;s face bore numerous scars as a result of 13 cosmetic operations.\nThe bridge of Jackson&apos;s nose had disappeared and the right side had caved in, according to the paper. Jackson also reportedly had unexplained bruises on his knees and shins and bruising to his back, indicating a recent fall.  He was bald, the paper reports, with his shoulder-length hair just a wig. His hair has been reduced to a &quot;peach fuzz&quot; on his scalp, says the paper.\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed\nThe only thing pathologists found in the star&apos;s stomach were partially dissolved pills, which were removed for toxicology tests, according to the Sun.\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nSeveral of Jackson&apos;s ribs also had been broke as paramedics tried to revive the singer after he suffered cardiac arrest at his rented L.A. home, according to reports. There also were four injections around his heart, presumably from adrenaline shots during the failed resuscitation.\n&quot;He was skin and bone, his hair had fallen out and he had been eating nothing but pills when he died,&quot; the paper quotes a source as saying.  &quot;Injection marks all over his body and the disfigurement caused by years of plastic surgery show he&apos;d been in terminal decline for years.  \nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nTwo autopsies were conducted on Jackson: One by the Los Angeles coroner and another by a private pathologist hired by the Jackson family.\nOn Sunday, a lawyer for Dr. Conrad Murray - the singer&apos;s private pathologist who discovered Jackson in bed and not breathing last Thursday - denied various media reports that Dr. Conrad prescribed or gave Jackson the drugs Demerol or OxyContin.   &quot;Not ever. featured on the show. &quot;Deanna&apos;s role isn&apos;t expected to be big, but because she&apos;s part of Jon&apos;s life, she&apos;ll be filmed,&quot; an insider told the paper.\nBut a network rep tells Entertainment Tonight, &quot;There are no plans to use her.&quot;  \nSee more controversial photos of Jon and Deanna Hummel\nIn an interview with The New York Times, TLC president Eileen O&apos;Neill addressed the network&apos;s decision to stop airing the show until Aug. 3 in light of the couple&apos;s split.\n&quot;It&apos;s hard to walk away from a big number,&quot; O&apos;Neill said, referring to Monday&apos;s record 10.6 million viewers. &quot;But it really made sense so that everyone could adjust to the new circumstances.&quot;\n&quot;Once we understood that they were going to make an announcement [regarding their split], we discussed various scenarios with them,&quot; she said. &quot;We really collaborated on what would make sense for the family.&quot;  \nSee the Gosselin family through the years\nAsked whether there was a chance the show could be postponed further, she said she was &quot;very confident&quot; in the August return date.\nCould the show be canceled?  &quot;That&apos;s not in anyone&apos;s mind,&quot; O&apos;Neill said, adding that she did not have a &quot;hard date&quot; for when the Gosselins plan to resume filming.  \nSee how the Gosselins have spent summer\nAsked how the show will change, she said, &quot;We anticipate that the focus will remain on the parent-child relationship.&quot;  \nSee what Kate looked like in high \"Blanket,\" 7, teased and chased around his cousins", "articleBody": "After Tuesday&apos;s somber memorial for their father, Michael Jackson&apos;s three children seemed to be in better sprits at a reception immediately following the service.\r\nPrince Michael, 12, Paris Katherine, 11, and Prince Michael II (Blanket), 7, all sat in the &quot;VIP&quot; area at a kid&apos;s table that included all the Jackson cousins and relatives in The Grand Ballroom at the Regent Beverly Wilshire Hotel.\r\n\r\nThere were around 15 kids at the table, with ages ranging from 7-17. (Blanket was probably the youngest in the group.)  \r\nJackson&apos;s children seemed very close with their cousins, as they all were playing and goofing around.\r\nAt one point, Prince Michael pulled out his cell phone. It looked like he was playing a game on it; he then passed it along to one of his cousins.\r\n\r\nBlanket &#x2013; who appeared overwhelmed at the memorial &#x2013; was in a much better mood. He looked like he was having so much fun chasing around his cousins. The boy &#x2013; whose hair is almost down to his waist and whose front tooth is missing &#x2013; appeared playful at the reception, tickling his cousins and tapping others on the shoulder and then running away.\r\nParis also seemed to be in a better mood. She hugged her cousins and chatted with guests.\r\nAt one point, someone brought over the program from the memorial and all three of the kids &#x2013; including some of the cousins &#x2013; gathered around to look at the pictures.\r\nJackson&apos;s children seemed really poised and polite as they shook guests&apos; hands and chatted with them. People were coming up and shaking Prince Michael&apos;s hand a lot. The kids interacted extremely naturally with each other.\r\n\r\nGrace Rwaramba, Jackson&apos;s former nanny, was overheard saying: &quot;The kids are holding up really well. It&apos;s good for them to be around the other kids.&quot;\r\nThe reception featured a classical music quartet that played softly onstage. (Food included mini cheeseburgers, spanakopita, mini crab cakes, vegetable plates, cheese plates and fruit.)\r\nTodd Bridges, Corey Feldman, Chris Tucker, Brooke Shields, Wesley Snipes, Rev. Al Sharpton, Kim Porter, Mariah Carey, Jesse Jackson, Spike Lee and Anil Kapoor from Slumdog Millionaire were among the guests.  \r\nUsher pretty much kept to himself and still looked sad.\r\nAs for Jackson&apos;s siblings, Latoya made the rounds at the reception, greeting guests. Janet did not really interact with her family, only to chat with sister Latoya momentarily. (Both ladies kept their sunglasses on the entire time.)  Janet also carried around Blanket&apos;s Michael Jackson doll for him. (Her beau Jermaine Dupri did not attend.)\r\nJoe and Katherine Jackson briefly chatted up Brooke Shields, who was smiling but still mourning as her eyes were red.\r\n \r\nJermaine Jackson talked to family members and hugged a lot of the guests.\r\nAt the end of the evening, a few guests took photos with Wesley Snipes, Usher and even Joe Jackson.\r\nFeldman, still dressed in his bizarre Michael Jackson outfit, gave Joe Jackson a hug and a handshake on the way out.\r\nMichael&apos;s three kids left with Katherine Jackson, who remains their temporary guardian until a July 13 court hearing.", I don&apos;t know what the future is. I certainly don&apos;t have any political aspirations,&quot; he says. &quot;Hopefully, I can get done what needs to be done by working with people who do have those aspirations.&quot;\nFor now, he enjoys spending time in New Orleans and the South of France, where Knox and Viv were born last July.  \nSee adorable photos of the Jolie-Pitt twins.\n&quot;There&apos;s real value in the quality of life in France. on Scrape TV, weeks after Jackson died at the age of 50.   \nRelive Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\nHe was quoted as saying: &quot;It&apos;s so sad to see Michael gone but it makes a path for a new King of Pop and I&apos;m willing to take that on. There&apos;s nobody who can match me in sales and in respect so it only makes sense for me to take over Michael&apos;s crown and become the new King.&quot;\nHowever, West claims he never said anything about the late icon.  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his three kids.\n&quot;I was just listening to [radio host] and heard some quote about me saying I&apos;m the new King of Pop,&quot; he wrote. &quot;Not only did I not say that, I haven&apos;t said anything. It makes me feel bad that obviously I made people feel that I would be corny enough to say something so whack after the passing of an idol, a legend and more than that, a human being with feelings and family.&quot;\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life in photos.\nHe continued: &quot;It scares me to think what people will believe, without even a source. Any random person can type something on the internet and then the world believes it. I don&apos;t talk to press or do TV or do promotions of any sort. I&apos;ve stopped chasing and buying into fame. Fame is like cigarettes with no surgeon general warning. It destroys most people as it did to the true and only king of pop. We exploit ourselves and eat our own egos &apos;till there is nothing left. I have a feeling that this won&apos;t be the last false statement with my name on it, but this will be the last time I defend myself. Megan Fox isn&apos;t one of them.\n&quot;It&apos;s a lack of creativity on the media&apos;s part,&quot; the Transformers star says in the latest issue of Entertainment Weekly (on newsstands June 12). &quot;Because I have tattoos and dark hair and I was in an action movie? That&apos;s as far as the similarities extend.&quot;\nSee if you can guess which star legs belong to Megan and Angelina!\nAdds Fox, &quot;I&apos;m not the next anyone.&quot;  The 23-year-old actress -- who says she was joking when she once said she was afraid of the Changeling star -- admits that she has no plans to get to know Jolie.   \nSee what Megan Fox and all the stars wore to the 2009 MTV Movie Awards!\n&quot;She always seems otherworldly in her power and her confidence,&quot; Fox says. &quot;I&apos;m sure she has no idea who I am. But if I were her, I&apos;d be like, &apos;Who the f--- is this little bulls--- brat who was in Transformers that&apos;s going to be the next me?&apos; I don&apos;t want to meet her. I&apos;d be embarrassed.&quot;\nFox even interjects when asked if she wanted to follow in Jolie&apos;s footsteps of starting out as a sex symbol before taking on serious roles.  &quot;Angelina Jolie was always a Method actress,&quot; she says. &quot;She&apos;d been nominated for Golden Globes before she ever did Tomb Raider.&quot;  \nSee photos of Angelina Jolie through the years.\nStill, the star -- who admits &quot;I&apos;m clearly not ugly&quot; -- isn&apos;t bothered by the fact that she&apos;s seen as a sex symbol.\n&quot;I don&apos;t know why someone would complain about that,&quot; she says. &quot;That just means that the bar has been set pretty low. People don&apos;t expect me to do anything that&apos;s worth watching. So I can only be an overachiever. I think all women in Hollywood are known as sex symbols. That&apos;s what our purpose is in this business. You&apos;re merchandised, you&apos;re a product. You&apos;re sold and it&apos;s based on sex. But that&apos;s okay. I think women should be empowered by that, not degraded.&quot;\nIn fact, she doesn&apos;t regret how Transformers made her &quot;this new girl&quot; in the industry.  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\n&quot;I happened to be such an outrageous personality that people wanted to start writing about me because it was deemed controversial,&quot; she says. &quot;I think if I had been a typical Hollywood actress and I said all the right things and I had been a publicity android, it wouldn&apos;t have escalated to this level.&quot;\nFox, who appears in this summer&apos;s blockbuster Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen, doesn&apos;t want to still be making robot movies five years from now, but when asked what the worst-case scenario would be, she says, &quot;That I&apos;d be on I just can&apos;t believe.&quot;\r\nSee more of today&apos;s top celeb news photos\r\nGeller also told Sky News that he believed Jackson to be in fine health.  &quot;He was in good shape. ... I&apos;m not a doctor, but I can only assume he was under immense stresses and pressures, and you can ask any doctor, stress is a killer,&quot; he said. &quot;The pressure of these concerts, putting under huge pressures, he was a perfectionist. That could have been what did it. But that&apos;s just my opinion.&quot;\r\nJackson was set to headline 50 sold-out shows at London&apos;s O2 Arena beginning in July, billed &quot;This Is It&quot; -- his final London performances.  &quot;I think it was a mistake to target 50 shows. 3, 4, 5 maybe 10 shows is enough,&quot; said Geller. &quot;He was healthy, aerobically fit. I remember him here in my house, and he wouldn&apos;t touch junk food. So now... to confront this devastating reality that Michael is dead is just... I want to wake up tomorrow and think this is a dream and that he is not dead.&quot;\r\nAdded Geller, &quot;He was a happy man when fans were around - he drank their love. He loved what he did, but somewhere in his deep dark corners of his heart, he was a confused man and a lonely person. The reason was because nobody could understand him.&quot;\r\n&quot;He is in heaven now, a better place than us. https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bret-michaels-i-got-blindsided-at-the-tonys-2009116/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bret-michaels-i-got-blindsided-at-the-tonys-2009116/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/bret-michaels-i-got-blindsided-at-the-tonys-2009116/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Bret Michaels: I Got &#8220;Blindsided&#8221; at the Tonys", "datePublished": "2009-06-11T20:16:12-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:38-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "\"I found it a little strange that the only statement released by the Tony organization was that I missed my mark,\" he says", "articleBody": "Bret Michaels has released a statement blasting producers of the 63rd annual Tony Awards for the way they handled his injury on the June 7 show.\nMichaels, 46, broke his nose and busted his lip after he was hit by a sign descending from the ceiling as he left the stage following Poison&apos;s performance of &quot;Nothin&apos; But a Good Time&quot; with the Rock of Ages cast.\n&quot;I am trying to remain very positive and somewhat humorous about the whole situation. I apologize that I did not make a statement earlier as I have been feeling pretty beat up over the last few days. The fact is I was honored to be asked to perform at the event. The entire &quot;Rock of Ages&quot; production were awesome and even though I was completely out of my element I was really enjoying myself prior to my injury. In fact all involved at the awards show treated me good.&quot;\n&quot;I had a great time at the Tonys right up until I got blindsided, I must admit it was a little blurry after that. In hindsight, there is no doubt I got my bell rung, unfortunately it has been posted and perhaps funny to watch, but I can assure you it has been painful to experience. In all honesty I had absolutely no idea what struck my head. Upon impact I thought a piece of the lighting rig had fallen out of the ceiling and as I fell back it seemed like my head struck the stage and I blacked out for a second. When I opened my eyes I noticed a large set prop coming down straight for me. I immediately pushed myself out of the way and amidst the chaos I laid on the floor and asked &quot;what the hell just happened?&quot;   \nSee more rocking celeb romances\n&quot;My nose, mouth and the back of my head felt numb. I vaguely remember asking Big John, &apos;Do I have any teeth left in my mouth?&apos; I knew I could move my arms and legs and that was an instant relief. Somebody handed me a towel to wipe the blood from my face and in my dazed state I recall staring at what seemed to be Shrek, a talking goat head and several monkey like creatures.&quot;\n&quot;Over the last few days a lot of speculation as to what happened and who is to blame have surfaced. I need to make clear at no point since the incident occurred do I feel like the accident was malicious in any way and I feel this will all work itself out. However I must state I found it a little strange that the only statement released by the Tony organization was that I missed my mark and that I was completely fine. First, I thought, &apos;what mark?&apos; as there was no official mark, just a retracting drum riser and an overhead prop being rapidly lowered which was out of my view. Second, I think it was slightly irresponsible for them to report that I was fine without full knowledge of my condition, when a doctor hadn&apos;t even looked at me yet and I surely don&apos;t remember any X-Ray machines backstage. I am not looking for an apology, I only hoped that on a human level that the Tony organizations&apos; representative would have expressed some concern for injury in their statement or at the very least claim they would be looking into the matter.&quot;\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news pics\nFind out Bret Michael&apos;s celeb crush\nSee then-and-now shots of Neil Patrick Harris and other 90 TV It never happened!&quot;\r\nKathy Griffin -- who also appeared on The View Friday -- joked that she&apos;d pay the lad mag to let her pose nude dressed up as Kate.\r\nCheck out Kate&apos;s high school yearbook photo\r\n&quot;Why don&apos;t we do a nude...lesbo thing?&quot; Griffin asked Kate.\r\nHer response?\r\n&quot;Oh, wow,&quot; Kate said.\r\nKate also told Griffin she laughed at a video the comic filmed for Jimmy Kimmel Live. In the clip, Griffin dons a wig, screams at her kids and rolls her eyes as estranged husband Jon -- played by Star Trek&apos;s George Takei -- makes out with a cheerleader.\r\n&quot;I watched it online and I didn&apos;t know what to expect,&quot; she said. &quot;I caught myself cracking up out loud.\r\nKate -- who was back to her wavy &apos;do -- also discussed tabloid reports that Jon&#xA0;slept with a former nanny, Stephanie Santoro, while his kids were home.\r\n&quot;Well, I guess it&apos;s the article of the week and basically my only comment on that -- just based on the behavior of the last several months -- I&apos;m not surprised,&quot; Kate said. &quot;Honestly, I don&apos;t know. We were separated. It goes back to the recent police being called, blah blah blah.\r\n&quot;I need to say about this article, I&apos;m not saying it&apos;s true or false,&quot; she went on. &quot;All I&apos;m talking about is what my intuition is saying. The background story is I had never met this babysitter.&quot; (Us Weekly reported Jon and Santoro -- who sold $2 shots at local bar Legends Lounge -- had a sexy sleepover in early August.)\r\nIn August, cops were called to the the family&apos;s $1.1-million Pennsylvania home after Kate showed up while Jon was supposed to have custody of their eight kids.\r\nKate explained: &quot;I learned that he asked this babysitter to come over when he was not going to be home. It started out very friendly. I called him and said, &apos;If you&apos;re not going to be home, can I come?&apos;&quot;\r\nCheck out pictures from Jon and Kate&apos;s summer\r\nKate says her &quot;alarms and whistles&quot; were going off about Santoro. &quot;I asked him kindly to use the approved babysitters we have,&quot; she said.\r\nKate said she &quot;sat at the gate and just sobbed.&quot;\r\nJoy Behar pointed out that Kate was &quot;winning the PR award.&quot;\r\nSaid Kate: I&apos;m not out to win any awards. https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jackson-family-attorney-prescription-drugs-may-have-caused-death-2009266/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jackson-family-attorney-prescription-drugs-may-have-caused-death-2009266/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jackson-family-attorney-prescription-drugs-may-have-caused-death-2009266/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Jackson Family Attorney: Prescription Drugs May Have Caused Death", "datePublished": "2009-06-26T11:17:59-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:08-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Brian Oxman blames the singer's \"handlers\" for \"enabling\" him; \"I warned that his day may come\"", "articleBody": "Although the exact cause of Michael Jackson&apos;s death remains unknown, Brian Oxman - who has served as the family&apos;s attorney for more than 20 years - suspects prescription drug abuse may have played a role.\n&quot;I don&apos;t know what caused Michael&apos;s death, and I don&apos;t want to speculate as to what the causes are,&quot; Oxmon tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;I only know that I warned them there was the misuse of prescription medications by people who were enabling him; his handlers, folks who should never have been permitted to allow him to use those medications in the manner I observed.&quot;\n&quot;So is that the cause of it? I don&apos;t know,&quot; he continues. &quot;People die from various and sundry causes - they have congenital malformations of the heart, they have difficulty with various infections. I don&apos;t know what Michael Jackson&apos;s death is a result of.&quot;\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nOxmon says the 50-year-old Jackson -- who suffered cardiac arrest and was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. PST Thursday -- &quot;had no particular health concerns except that he had broken his leg many years ago, and it hurt him.&quot;\n&quot;He had cracked a vertebrae in his back and he took painkillers to try to ease the pain,&quot; he says. &quot;And now we find ourselves here. I don&apos;t know if the two are connected. I had warned that the misuse of medications would result in this, and I am heartbroken that we are here.&quot;\nThough some reports claim Jackson may have overdosed on Demerol, Oxmon declined to elaborate on the types of medications Jackson was taking &quot;because it is something which is private to Michael, and we&apos;ll have to wait for the toxicology reports before we jump to any kind of conclusions. I only know that I warned that his day may come. And lo and behold, here we are.&quot;\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nAn autopsy is planned for Friday, but results may not be final until toxicology tests can be completed, which could take several days and sometimes weeks. Los Angeles County Coroner Investigator Jerry McKibben said if a cause can be determined by the autopsy, they will announce the results.\n&quot;We will have to wait to see what the toxicology reports have to say, what the coroners report has to say,&quot; Oxmon says. &quot;When that happens, I will be very vocal. It could very well be he died from natural causes, in which case, my gosh, the tragedy becomes even greater.&quot;  \nSee today&apos;s top celeb news pics\nJackson was set to headline 50 sold-out shows, billed &quot;This Is It,&quot; at London&apos;s O2 Arena beginning in July -- his final London performances.  Oxman did not know if Jackson had been examined before the tour, but &quot;he has been in good health,&quot; he says.\nAs he rehearsed for the concerts, &quot;He had been making his very best efforts to be pain-free, but it&apos;s been very difficult to him,&quot; Oxmon says.\n&quot;But I was not aware, and I don&apos;t think any of the family members were aware, of any kind of specific condition which was causing him any kind of medical or physical difficulty,&quot; he continues. &quot;I don&apos;t know what the extent of his exercise routine was. But I do know that he was making good progress toward getting ready to perform at the show.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": her &quot;celeb dream date&quot; for prom).\r\nThe new issue of Us Weekly, on stands today, also includes details on how Swift&apos;s pals helped her bounce back from the VMA incident.\r\n\r\nAfter the show, she went to dinner at Del Frisco&apos;s at midnight to meet a group and received a standing ovation, an insider says.\r\n&quot;Taylor&apos;s friends ordered her favorite dish, macaroni and cheese, to cheer her up,&quot; the source adds. &quot;And nobody brought up Kanye West.&quot;\r\nFor more details -- including how Swift burst into tears moments before her live performance, which In fact, quite the opposite.  In the February issue of Harper&apos;s Bazaar (out January 16), she advises couples not to take their love life too seriously. &apos;Don&apos;t take love and your relationship so g-ddamned heavy all the time,&quot; says the free-spirited actress. &quot;Laugh, laugh, laugh!&quot;\r\nMore highlights from Drew&apos;s Harper&apos;s interview below:\r\nOn how to live life:&#xA0;&quot;You know, it&apos;s all just humor. Don&apos;t take life too seriously. Don&apos;t take fashion too seriously. Don&apos;t take the movie industry too seriously... Life is high school and it&apos;s small and everybody talks about everybody, so just laugh your ass off.&quot;\r\nOn working with Hugh Grant in Music and Lyrics:&#xA0;&quot;Hugh makes me laugh so hard. He&apos;s such an odd bird, and I love him so much for it.&quot;&#xA0;\r\nOn wanting to work with Sacha Baron Cohen of Borat:&#xA0;&quot;I like smart, weird, funny and sharp. The guys I had crushes on growing up were Ted Koppel and David Letterman.&quot;\r\nOn her relationship with Moretti:&#xA0;&quot;You need to reinvent your relationship if you want to continue being together.  Right now I&apos;m in a phase of, I&apos;m not even your girlfriend. I&apos;m your best friend who is madly in love with you. I&apos;m really interested in watching him right now. The longest I&apos;ve ever been with someone was like two to three years, so I&apos;m in uncharted waters. Right now I&apos;m more into championing him as a human being than gushing love for him.&quot;&#xA0;\r\nOn starring in fashion designer Giles Deacon&apos;s ad campaign:&#xA0;&quot;I honestly can&apos;t believe anyone would ever hire me.  I am like the girl on the couch who eats the Chinese food.  I don&apos;t have the body type. I don&apos;t have the daily stylishness. I can&apos;t believe they&apos;re letting a funny jester like me get involved in fashion.&quot;\r\nOn her style:&#xA0;&quot;What I&apos;m nuts for is sensible real clothes. Whenever you know, John Galliano [a close friend] gives me a dress to wear, I feel like Cinderella.&quot;&#xA0;\r\nOn her body:&#xA0;&quot;I am constantly battling my weight. I want to eat whatever I want and get away with it, but I can&apos;t. I want to wear whatever I want, but I can&apos;t.&quot;\r\nOn advice for Lindsay Lohan:&#xA0;&quot;I know Lindsay, and I like her very much... You just have to try to be as graceful as you can. You know, you flub, you flub. And that&apos;s life... George told reporters during a press conference Thursday.\n&quot;As many of you know, my belief is that the pending custody proceedings are the most private and the most sensitive of matters as they impact the lives and the fates of young children. To that end, I&apos;ve endeavored out of respect for Michael&apos;s children and family, especially in this time of grieving, to keep silence on these matters, to deny all interview requests and to share only that information involving upcoming public court proceedings.&quot;\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nEarlier Thursday, NBCLA&apos;s Chuck Henry reported that he has spoken to Rowe - mother of Prince, 12, and Paris, 11 - and she told him, &quot;I want my children.&quot;\nAlthough Rowe herself has not spoken publicly about the custody proceedings, George said, &quot;I have no reason to doubt that what was reported from that conversation was accurately and ethically reported, but that said, it would be a distortion of the truth to allow that single snapshot of a single conversation, to stand as the truth on Debbie&apos;s position on this sensitive matter.&quot;  \nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\n&quot;Once again, the truth is that Debbie has not reached a final decision concerning the pending custody proceedings,&quot; he concluded. &quot;When Debbie does take a position in the public forum of a court, those positions will, of course, be conveyed to all interested persons.  In the meantime, I very much appreciate everybody&apos;s continued respect for Debbie&apos;s privacy at this time, and I&apos;m very sorry, but I cannot address any questions at this time.&quot;  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\nIn Jackson&apos;s will (released Wednesday) the singer - who died at age 50 after suffering cardiac arrest June 25 -- named his mother Katherine as guardian of his three children -- Prince, Paris and 7-year-old Blanket. (If Katherine died before him or couldn&apos;t serve as guardian, Jackson nominated Diana Ross, according to Jackson&apos;s will.)\nHe &quot;intentionally&quot; omitted Rowe from his will, he said.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nLast week, Katherine filed a petition in Los Angeles Probate Court seeking legal guardianship of the children. (In her 22-page petition, she claims the children &quot;have no relationship with their biological mother.&quot;)\nA guardianship hearing scheduled for Monday has been postponed until July 13 at the request of attorneys for Rowe and Katherine Jackson.\nRowe wed Jackson in 1996 (he was a patient in the dermatologist&apos;s office, where she worked as a nurse). The children were born through artificial insemination. (The new issue of Us Weekly exclusively reports that the children&apos;s father is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist and Rowe&apos;s former boss.)\nAfter Jackson and Rowe divorced in 1999, she agreed to give up her parental rights, insisting Jackson was a good father.\nSince their father&apos;s passing, the kids have been with the Jackson family and &quot;are happy,&quot; Jackson patriarch Joe said at a press conference Monday. They&apos;re with &quot;other young ones in the Jackson family.... I don&apos;t care anymore,&quot; Carey, 40, tells the Associated Press.\r\n&quot;Sometimes I like that [left] side -- and Nick likes that side better anyway,&quot; she adds, referring to her husband of about 18 months, Nick Cannon.\r\n\r\nCarey filmed the flick (due in theaters Nov. 6) without makeup and in a prosthetic nose -- which she called &quot;such a freeing experience for me.&quot;\r\n&quot;By making me look so bad [the director] brought out the ability to never be self-conscious again, and that was a gift that he gave me,&quot; says Carey, who nabbed the role after Oscar winner Helen Mirren dropped out. Outlast Lipstain in red.  &quot;A lot of time, red lipstick bleeds and when you&apos;re drinking, it gets everywhere, so that&apos;s why I like the lipstain,&quot; the single Ramirez tells Us. &quot;And when you make out and give kisses, you don&apos;t get red all over them. Hudgens paused.\r\n&quot;Yes, fine - we kiss in the movie,&quot; she replied, referring to High School Musical 3, which opens today.\r\n\r\nHow does she like his hair - gelled back or on the side with bangs - DeGeneres then asked.\r\n&quot;What do you like?&quot; said Hudgens.  &quot;I kind of like it with the side bangs, just kind of lose,&quot; she said. -- that Janet designed for our wedding.\r\nI had sent her several photos of centerpieces that I loved and told her that our color scheme consisted of warm fall colors including red, orange, and gold. She put together these big centerpieces that were lush with flowers and greenery, including tangerine orchids, curly willow branches and cherry love roses. They were simply gorgeous. She also designed a bridal bouquet for me and as soon as she handed it to me, I never wanted to put it down! It was beautiful!\r\nShe also set up a more contemporary set of flowers for her vision as to how our cocktail room should look like. We absolutely fell in love with it! (The whole look costs $28,000.) She also laid out several linens on round tables and paired them with a variety of chairs. I always liked chiavari chairs, but would never expect to have them at our reception because they typically cost so much money. But she showed us so many other chair options that I never even knew existed!\r\nI am really excited to see how the reception venue will look once its all put together. I am totally blown away by the ideas Janet has thought up for us and I cannot wait to share it with our family and friends! (More than 1.6 million fans registered online for a chance to attend the Staples Center ceremony; only 8,750 names were chosen).  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nWhen asked if Rowe had been in contact with the Jackson family, Schaffel claimed she has attempted to get in touch with the late singer&apos;s family, but has been unsuccessful. (Usmagazine.com reported late last week that the Jacksons have not yet reached out to Rowe.)\n&quot;There has been outreach, unfortunately, like so many cases, there&apos;s so much going on that they just have not been able to make contact,&quot; Schaffel said. &quot;There were several tries, just for the fact of phone numbers that had changed, you know, answering machines that were full. Contact had not been able to happen prior.&quot;  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nAs for reports that Rowe is planning on seeking custody of Jackson&apos;s eldest children, Prince Michael, 12, Paris, 11, Schaffel wouldn&apos;t comment.\n&quot;All I can say is the only one that could give an answer to that would be Debbie Rowe&apos;s lawyers, and they&apos;re the only ones that could make any kind of official statement on that or obviously make any statement regarding that,&quot; he said.  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\nOn Thursday, Rowe&apos;s attorney Eric George told Us she &quot;has not reached a final decision concerning the custody proceedings.&quot;\nRowe &#x2013; who was spotted over the weekend at her Palmdale, Calif., horse farm &#x2013; has not spoken publicly about the custody proceedings, but told NBCLA&apos;s Chuck Henry in a phone conversation (that was not broadcast) last week that she wants the kids. &quot;I have no reason to doubt that what was reported from that conversation was accurately and ethically reported, but that said, it would be a distortion of the truth to allow that single snapshot of a single conversation, to stand as the truth on Debbie&apos;s position on this sensitive matter,&quot; her attorney told Us.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nA guardianship hearing scheduled for Monday has been postponed until July 13 at the request of attorneys for Rowe and Katherine Jackson.\nRowe wed Jackson in 1996 (he was a patient in the dermatologist&apos;s office, where she worked as a nurse). The children were born through artificial insemination. (The new issue of Us Weekly exclusively reports that the children&apos;s father is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist and Rowe&apos;s former boss.)\nAfter Jackson and Rowe divorced I&apos;ve had two kids. I&apos;m 33. I don&apos;t look in the mirror and go, &apos;Oh, I look fantastic&apos; Of course I don&apos;t. Nobody is perfect,&quot; Winslet tells the UK Daily Mail. &quot;I just don&apos;t believe in perfection. But I do believe in saying, &apos;This is who I am and look at me not being perfect!&quot; I&apos;m proud of that.&apos;&quot;  Describing her flaws, she jokes, &quot;What&apos;s not perfect about me? Here we go: crumble baby belly...boobs are worse for wear after two kids...&quot;\r\n\r\nThe five-time Oscar-nominated actress, who is mom to Joe, 5, and Mia, 8, tries to keep a healthy diet, but doesn&apos;t restrict what she eats.  &quot;I&apos;m not a supermodel and I do whatever I can just to stay healthy,&quot; she says. &quot;I don&apos;t go to the gym. I mean, I go through phases where I think: &apos;Oh, I really should go and do a class.&apos; I don&apos;t have a trainer or a cook.&quot;  Her one diet secret: a pilates DVD, which she works out at home &quot;on the living room carpet,&quot; she says.  &quot;Here&apos;s what&apos;s so great about it: no one&apos;s looking at you, no one&apos;s telling you what to do or work harder or anything like that,&quot; she explains. &quot;I know it seems slightly tragic, but it&apos;s my way of exercising in a time-efficient way.  &quot;I have a mat and little hand weights and I do a stomach thing and a bum thing. It&apos;s very simple - you barely break into a sweat,&quot; she adds.  &quot;My body&apos;s different. It has settled into what it is now. None of this different diets lark. I can&apos;t remember the last time I tried some new fad.&quot;  She continues: &quot;Honestly I eat anything, although the only thing I don&apos;t is pasta, because it gives me a stomach ache.&quot;\r\n\r\nMeanwhile, Winslet, who is married to director Sam Mendes also opened up about giving her children a normal upbringing.  &quot;I cook at home. I have a cleaner and a baby-sitter, but my mantra is &apos;Keep it simple,&apos;&quot; she says. &quot;I don&apos;t want staff running around. for making a lewd joke about her daughter.\n&quot;I would like to see him apologize to young women across the country for contributing to kind of that thread that is throughout our culture that makes it sound like it is OK to talk about young girls in that way, where it&apos;s kind of OK, accepted and funny to talk about statutory rape,&quot; she said. &quot;It&apos;s not cool. It&apos;s not funny.&quot;  \nCheck out photos of the Palin family on the campaign trail\nOn his show earlier this week, Letterman joked that Palin&apos;s daughter got &quot;knocked up&quot; by Alex Rodriguez during their recent trip to New York&apos;s Yankee Stadium. He later clarified that the crack was aimed at Palin&apos;s 18-year-old daughter Bristol, even though it was her 14-year-old daughter, Willow, who had been at the ball game.  \nFind out which other stars were teen moms\nDespite Letterman&apos;s clarification, Palin wasn&apos;t happy, calling it &quot;a degrading comment about a young woman.&quot;  &quot;No wonder young girls especially have such low self-esteem in America when we think it&apos;s funny for a so-called comedian to get away with such a remark as he did,&quot; she said. &quot;I don&apos;t think that&apos;s acceptable.&quot;  \nSee pics of more star scandals\nPalin also said there was a double standard where the media treats President Barack Obama&apos;s family as generally off-limits while her family has been publicly ridiculed.  She also denied that it was also in bad taste for her spokeswoman, Meghan Stapleton, to say that Palin would not appear on Letterman&apos;s show because &quot;it would be wise to keep Willow away from David Letterman.&quot;\n&quot;Maybe he couldn&apos;t be trusted because Willow has had enough of this type of comments and maybe Willow would want to react to him in a way that maybe would catch him off-guard,&quot; Palin said. &quot;That&apos;s one way to interpret such a comment.&quot;\nOn his show Thursday, Letterman kept the Palin jokes alive.  He told the audience that &quot;everything&apos;s fine now&quot; between him and Palin, then adding that the Alaska Gov. called and invited him to go hunting.  &quot;I&apos;m Dave Letterman,&quot; he NBC would not disclose the nature of Tierney&apos;s illness.   &quot;The top priority for NBC, Universal Media Studios and Imagine Television is the well-being of Ms. Tierney,&quot; the rep said. &quot;We are unable to release further details and ask that you respect her privacy at this time.&quot;  \nSee photos of other stars who have overcome illness\nTierney, who just ended her 10-year stint as a doctor on ER, was supposed to begin filming Parenthood, which is a contemporary look at the 1989 film of the same name, on July 27.  The show revolves around four siblings -- Tierney, Peter Krause, Erika Christensen and Dax Shepard -- and their parents.  The series was scheduled to premiere Sept. 23.  &quot;Due to these circumstances, NBC&apos;s new drama series Mercy will premiere in the fall,&quot; NBC&apos;s rep told Us. &quot;Details on changes to NBC&apos;s fall premiere dates will be forthcoming.&quot;  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories\nThe Hollywood Reporter, who first reported Tierney&apos;s illness, reported that the delay will give more time to writers to finesse scripts.   This isn&apos;t the first time filming on Parenthood has been put on hold. Shepherd, 41, says.\r\nAt the time, the stand-up comic -- then a Jehovah&apos;s Witness -- was &quot;in a very physically abusive relationship,&quot; she said.\r\n&quot;I was sleeping with a lot of guys and had more abortions than I would like to count.&quot; She said her self-esteem became so low, &quot;I felt if someone killed me, it wouldn&apos;t even make a difference.&quot;  But after converting to Christianity, she said, &quot;God showed me that it would make a difference.&quot;  (Shepherd has also said she relied on her faith to get through her split with husband Jeff Tarpley, father of their 3-year-old son. During their seven-year marriage, Tarpley cheated on her and got another woman pregnant.)\r\nStill, Shepherd admitted it is tough talking religion on the popular ABC chat-fest. (She received criticism after she once remarked that ancient Greeks persecuted Christians, even though Christ hadn&apos;t been born yet.)\r\n&quot;Oh, sometimes I say, &apos;Lord, Juanita Bynum or Joyce Meyer would be so good at this table. They could lay hands on Barbara Walters and get her saved,&apos;&quot; she said.  &quot;I ask the Lord, &apos;Why am I here?&apos;&quot; Shepherd added. &quot;I have to trust God when He says, Murray was with Jackson when he died on June 25.\r\nLast week, his Houston-based medical clinic and public storage unitt was raided by the police and he was identified as the target of a manslaughter investigation in court records.\r\nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial.\r\nAccording to the warrant filed in Harris County District Court, authorities were looking for &quot;items constituting evidence of the offense of manslaughter that tend to show that Dr. Conrad Murray committed the said criminal offense.&quot;  Despite authorities&apos; claims, Murray&apos;s lawyer, Ed Chernoff, has said the doctor didn&apos;t prescribe or administer anything that should have killed Jackson.\r\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years.\r\nMurray, Chernoff has said, &quot;was the last doctor standing when Michael Jackson died and it seems all the fury is directed toward him. Studios want it, but they are afraid of Middle America,&quot; Aniston later told January&apos;s GQ. &quot;They&apos;d want to change it; they&apos;re saying, &apos;Oh, you can&apos;t do that, people just can&apos;t imagine you...&quot;\nSee Jennifer Aniston&apos;s red carpet looks through the years\nAniston told GQ that &quot;there are too many movies out there that don&apos;t empower women, movies in which their only way of being happy is finding a man. And you know, that&apos;s not my favorite theme.&quot;  \nCompare the magazine covers Jen and Angelina have both posed on \nPumas is the latest project for Aniston. Cowell, who is currently heading into the final year of his current Idol contract, hinted in the spring that he might leave the show at the end of his deal before entering into negotiations for a multi-year agreement.\r\n\r\n&quot;We&apos;ve heard from Fox, who has asked us for approval for Simon Cowell to appear for three more years on Idol,&quot; CKX chariman Robert Sillerman said. &quot;They, in their negotiations with Cowell, have asked us to pre-approve him not only for American Idol &apos;09, which has begun taping, but they have also asked us for approval for &apos;10 and &apos;11, indicating to us that they&apos;re finishing their negotiation with Cowell. We did grant approval for that quite obviously.&quot;  With the new contract, Cowell could reportedly earn $45 million, up from $36 million a year under his current contract.\r\n\r\nLast week, fellow judge Abdul announced she was leaving the show after a reported salary dispute. Cowell will join judges Kara DioGuardi and Randy Jackson as well as host Ryan Seacrest -- who recently signed a similar three-year $45 million contract -- on the show&apos;s upcoming ninth season.", Earlier, a &quot;Buy it Now&quot; ticket was listed for $20,000, CBS News reports.\nSome 8,750 people were awarded two tickets each via an online lottery over the weekend. (More than 1.6 million people applied.)  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\nWhile the main ticket holder needs to enter a password and then pick up the wristbands at Dodger Stadium today, a Staples Center spokesman admits ticket scalping was out of their control.\n&quot;Theoretically, the second wristband can be sold,&quot; rep Michael Roth said.\nFans expressed outrage that people were making money off a public memorial.  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson with  his kids.\n&quot;These people are sick, How could they!&quot; wrote one online.\neBay promised to remove the listings, but they&apos;re still available.\n&quot;Any tickets for the memorial service will be taken down,&quot; an eBay rep said.\nFor Tuesday&apos;s memorial, 11,000 fans will be admitted to the Staples Center, and 6,500 will be let inside the Nokia Theater next door, which will simulcast the event.  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years.\nFans wearing ripped or altered bracelets will not be admitted, a Jackson family spokesperson confirmed to Usmagazine.com.\nPolice said Sunday the streets surrounding the theaters will be closed, although over 1 million fans are expected to gather nearby to pay their respects.   \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life.\nThe Wilshire Grand Los Angeles hotel, which is about a half mile from the Last year, Jewel and Nancy O&apos;Dell had to pull out of the show after being seriously injured, and now producers are only letting couples practice five hours per day. \r\n &quot;It&apos;s my first fear and concern because I had a foot fracture earlier this year. This is my first introduction into being able to be physical,&quot; she says. &quot;I try to rehearse in flats, and then put on heels to see how it feels.&quot;  So far, her foot seems fine, but she&apos;s struggling with &quot;blisters and bruises&quot; she admits.   &quot;I think my whole body has been in pain! Like director Mike Judge&apos;s Office Space, Extract sweetly satirizes work and domestic life, squeezing many laughs out of the daily grind at the company. says Grigorieva, 39, who is pregnant with Gibson&apos;s baby. &quot;We haven&apos;t really talked about it.&quot;     \r\nGet the latest Mel Gibson news\r\nShe also says they have opted not to learn the sex of the child.   &quot;I&apos;m already buying things in gender-neutral colors. It&apos;s very cute,&quot; says  Grigorieva, who also has a 12-year-old son, Alexander, with actor Timothy Dalton.  Grigorieva, who is signed to Gibson&apos;s record label, was first photographed with Gibson in 2008 on the set of his movie Edge of Darkness.\r\n\r\nThey made their first public appearance together at a Los Angeles screening of X-Men Origins: Wolverine on April 28 - the same month Gibson and his wife of nearly 30 years (and mother of his seven children), Robyn, filed for divorce.\r\n\r\nDespite intense scrutiny, Grigorieva says her relationship with Gibson has inspired her music. The actor directed four of her music videos.  &quot;If you think about it, every talent needs a serious push and help from somebody who is stronger, because it&apos;s pretty much impossible for anybody to succeed in this industry,&quot; she says. &quot;So I&apos;ve become very lucky, and I&apos;m very grateful.&quot;  \r\n\r\nAdds Grigorieva, &quot;You don&apos;t control the situations or the people you meet. I did not plan this. I&apos;m just doing what I&apos;ve always been doing. It&apos;s not like I&apos;ve changed my goals at all.&quot;  Before beginning press for the new album, Beautiful Heartache, she says Gibson even gave her some advice: &quot;Just be myself and speak the truth. Just not as Hannah Montana.\n&quot;I feel like this is a TV show. and we got really lucky with having the material to make one movie,&quot; she said Monday at a press conference for Hannah Montana: The Movie (out April 10). &quot;To do another one, I feel like it takes away the reality of it all.&quot;\nBut she would love to keep her alter ego on television.  &quot;We are continuing to do season three, and we all wish to do a season four, and I would love to do that if the time is right and if that&apos;s what everyone agrees on,&quot; she said. &quot;I don&apos;t know if I would do another film, but I would love to do another season. I think that would be what we would all agree on.&quot;  \nSee photos of Miley Cyrus and other stars at the Kids&apos; Choice Awards\nThis summer, she begins shooting a movie that Notebook author Nicholas Sparks wrote especially for her. Sparks has been simultaneously writing a novel (due this fall), from which the screenplay is adapted.\n&quot;You never really hear that the movie was written before the book,&quot; said Cyrus, 16. &quot;It&apos;s kind of a weird way to do that. But he wrote the movie before he wrote the book, and he wrote it with me in mind.&quot;\nSee what Miley Cyrus and other stars looked like as kids\nAlthough the movie is under wraps, it deals with family and love issues.\n&quot;I&apos;ve always been lucky to play parts that relate to me -- and this doesn&apos;t at all,&quot; Cyrus said of her upcoming role. &quot;I have my issues, but not as bad as this chick! I am happy to play someone who is just kind of out there and not someone that I am like.&quot;\nSee Miley Cyrus and other stars trying to bring back 80s style\nShe said she also looks forward to seeing &quot;if I&apos;m a good actress or not, or if I&apos;m just good at playing myself.&quot;  Asked what kids should do if they&apos;re torn between pursuing an acting dream or going to college, Cyrus joked, &quot;I say &apos;do it.&apos; Be a freak. He was 52 years old.  The singer and impressionist spent more than a decade as one of the most popular performers on the Las Vegas strip.\r\nHe was pronounced dead in his bed shortly after police and paramedics were summoned to his home about 3:45 a.m., according to the Associated Press.  A medical examination was conducted on Friday, but Clark County Coroner Michael Murphy released a statement saying it could take several weeks to receive laboratory results and determine the cause of death.  Gans&apos; manager and longtime friend, Chip Lightman, said Gans was in good health but slept poorly after Wednesday&apos;s show. He took a nap Thursday and stayed in bed through the evening. His wife, Julie, summoned police when she couldn&apos;t rouse him.  &quot;This makes no sense,&quot; said Lightman, adding that Gans watched his diet and didn&apos;t do drugs. &quot;I managed him 18 years, and health was never an issue.&quot;  Gans -- who performed on Broadway and even had a small role in 1988&apos;s Bull Durham -- was mourned by fellow Las Vegas entertainment legends.\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top celeb news stories.\r\n&quot;We were blessed to be touched by his generous spirit, kind heart and insurmountable talent,&quot; said fellow Vegas legends Siegfried Fischbacher and Roy Horn said in a statement.  Cher, who is currently doing shows at Caesars Palace, was equally upset.  &quot;I was shocked and saddened to hear of the sudden passing of such a unique and gifted talent,&quot; she told Entertainment Tonight.  Added former Vegas performer Celine Dion: &quot;Not only was he the best in his field, but he was such a kind and loving person... [it&apos;s] a feat not accomplished by many people, maybe only a handful of people. I don&apos;t think anyone ever did it like him.&quot;\r\nRevisit Michael Jackson&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x2122;s most unforgettable moments Jackson - who died June 25 at the age of 50 after suffering cardiac arrest -  &quot;opened the minds of people about music,&quot; Timberlake said. &quot;He opened the minds of people about culture. punching dancer Sherene Flash, 27, in the eye after the fan asked for a photograph after a London charity ball in September.\nAlthough prosecutors claimed it was a deliberate assault, Winehouse -- who had pleaded not guilty -- said she had felt intimidated by the drunken Flash and claimed she was too short to have hit the dancer in the face.  \nSee photos of Amy Winehouse and other stars with shockingly bad hair\nWinehouse&apos;s lawyer, Patrick Gibbs, said &quot;the main injury here was probably to Miss Flash&apos;s pride.&quot;\nThe judge said that after hearing the evidence, he could not be sure the blow had been deliberate. &quot;The charge is dismissed and the defendant discharged,&quot; he said.  \nSee Amy Winehouse&apos;s winter bikini bod!\nWinehouse, dressed in a knee-length black skirt, gray jacket and white shirt, shrugged as the verdict was announced.   &quot;I&apos;m relieved,&quot; she told reporters as she left the court. &quot;I&apos;m going home.&quot;\nIn a statement read by a spokesman, the &quot;Back to Black&quot; singer -- who was granted a divorce from her husband of two years, Blake Fielder-Civil, earlier this month -- said she was &quot;very happy (According to the code, authorities can hold a person involuntarily if they present a danger to themselves or others. This same code was used to hold Britney Spears twice in Los Angeles in January 2008.) The actress --  best known for her role on The O.C. -- was charged in 2008 with DUI and marijuana possession. She was sentenced to 36 months probation, told to attend alcohol education classes and pay a fine. The UP-TUCK, like you are tucking something in. Then I do a TUCK-UP. The UP-TUCK is when I position a small ponytail somewhere on the head, and then I tuck the rest of the hair up under that ponytail. Then a TUCK-UP is when I take the hair and gather it all in the back and I twist it and I pull up and tuck. And that is what she got last night! A TUCK UP! Not a cut.&quot;\nSee controversial celeb &apos;dos\nWright says he has given &quot;different celebrities&quot; the same look &quot;and it looks different every time depending on the length of the hair.&quot;\nSee Michelle and Barack&apos;s most memorable moments of 2008\nBut he notes, &quot;It&apos;s a really easy up do. And it looks really classy and appropriate for any occasion.&quot;  \nSee how Barack and Michelle Obama have spent the first 100 days in office\nAs for Michelle, &quot;I said to her that this would be a nice length for her whenever we decide to cut it, and she said yeah,&quot; Wright says. &quot;So now whenever we do cut it, I&apos;ll probably go shorter now because everyone thinks that&apos;s the who first worked with Jackson on 1979's Off the Wall - tells Details they'd talk \"all the time\" about how Jackson was changing.\r\n\r\n\"But he'd come up with, 'Man, I promise you I have this disease,' and so forth, and 'I have a blister on my lungs,' and all that kind of b.s.,\" he says. \"It's hard, because Michael's a Virgo, man -- he's very set in his ways. You can't talk him out of it. Chemical peels and all that stuff.\"\r\n\r\nSee how Michael Jackson's face has changed over the years\r\n\r\n\"I've been around junkies and stuff all my life. I've heard every excuse,\" he says. \"It's like smokers -- 'I only smoke when I drink' and all that stuff. But it's bulls**t. You're justifying something that's destructive to your existence. It's crazy.\"\r\n\r\nRevisit Michael Jackson's most unforgettable moments\r\n\r\nJones says Jackson's obsession with his appearances got to be \"ridiculous.\"\r\n\r\n\"Chemical peels and all of it. And I don't understand it,\" he says. \"But he obviously didn't want to be black.\" Asked if that is the reason Jackson had undergone so much plastic surgery, Jones says, \"Well, what do you think? You see his kids?\"\r\n\r\nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\r\n\r\nJones isn't sure why Jackson had such a deep-seated issue with the way he looked. (In a 1993 interview with Oprah Winfrey, The King of Pop said he used to wash his face in the dark because he had pimples. \"I wouldn't want to look in the mirror... and my father teased me,\" Jackson said. \"He would tell me I was ugly.\")\r\n\r\n\"I'm just a musician and a record producer. I'm not a psychiatrist,\" Jones says. \"I don't understand all that stuff. We all got problems. But there's a great book out called Too Soon Old, Too Late Smart. Did you see that? That book says the statute of limitations has expired on all childhood traumas. Get your stuff together and get on with your life, man. Stop whinin' about what's wrong, because everybody's had a rough time, in one way or another.\"\r\n\r\nLook back at Michael Jackson's life\r\n\r\nSo what does he think killed Jackson (who died June 25 at age 50 after suffering cardiac arrest)?\r\n\r\n\"I would think that the pressure of the concerts and the debt and everything else...\" he says. \"...If you sit there and just stay hung up on one negative thought, you will become that thought. I know that Lisa Marie Presley said that she always thought he was going to die like Elvis. You sit and think about that stuff, it'll happen to you. If you start thinking about darkness instead of light, or fear instead of love, you'll get in trouble. I really believe that.\"", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/quincy-jones-michael-jackson-didnt-want-to-be-black-200927/#webpage"}, "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", He was 50.\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nHe went into cardiac arrest at his Holmby Hills home in L.A. Thursday (a 911 call was placed shortly before 12:30 p.m. PT), according to TMZ, which first reported the news. Paramedics were unable to revive the singer (who had no pulse upon their arrival), the site reports.\nHe was then rushed to UCLA Medical Center while in a deep coma before passing away, The Los Angeles Times reported.  He was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. An autopsy is set for Friday.\nMichael&apos;s father, Joe Jackson, confirmed to E! News his son had a heart attack.  &quot;He is not OK,&quot; he said. &quot;His mother is on her way to the hospital now to check in on him.&quot;   \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nAccording to X17, more than 10 members of Michael&apos;s entourage arrived at the hospital just after 1 p.m. PST after following the ambulance.  &quot;They all got out of the SUVs in a panic and Michael was wheeled into the emergency room on a stretcher,&quot; the site reports. &quot;There was definitely a sense of urgency and everyone looked worried.&quot;  TMZ reports that his sister LaToya ran in the hospital sobbing after her brother was pronounced dead.\nSee more of today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nLOOKING BACK\nBorn Aug. 29, 1958, Michael Jackson was the seventh child of the famed Jackson family. He kicked off his career at age 11 as a child star in the band The Jackson 5. While still a member of group, he launched a solo career in 1971.  Jackson went on to win 13 Grammys and boast 13 number one singles. His 1982 album Thriller remains the biggest-selling album of all time, with more than 26 million copies.\nSaid Neil Portnow, of the Recording Academy: &quot;Rarely has the world received a gift with the magnitude of artistry, talent, and vision as Michael Jackson. He was a true musical icon whose identifiable voice, innovative dance moves, stunning musical versatility, and sheer star power carried him from childhood to worldwide acclaim. A 13-time GRAMMY recipient, Michael&apos;s career transcends musical and cultural genres and his contributions will always keep him in our hearts and memories. We are deeply saddened by this tragic news and our hearts go out to his family and to music lovers around the globe who mourn this great loss.&quot;\nJackson wasn&apos;t only known for his signing: He inspired countless artists  with his dance move known as the moonwalk. (However, he also outraged some with his crotch-grabbing dance moves.)\nDespite the professional success, he has drawn much criticism for his wacky personal life.   His physical features changed drastically: His skin became lighter and his nose narrower.  Jackson - who often wore a germ mask and kept a pet chimpanzee named Bubbles - also palled around with children at his Neverland ranch. In 2005, he was cleared of charges he molested a 13-year-old cancer survivor at Neverland in 2003.\nIn August 1994, Jackson wed Lisa Marie Presley but divorced in 1996. He went on to wed Debbie Rowe, a nurse. Two children were born through artificial insemination: Prince Michael Jackson, in 1997, and Paris Michael Jackson, in 1998. He also had a third child, Prince Michael Jackson II.\nJackson was set to headline 50 sold-out shows at London&apos;s O2 Arena beginning in July, billed &quot;This Is It&quot; -- his final London
