Jessica Simpson Lands Another Reality Show", "datePublished": "2009-06-22T15:25:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T20:59:31-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "She promises her new VH1 series about beauty will be \"a wild ride\"", "articleBody": "It&apos;s official: Jessica Simpson has landed another reality show.\r\nAs Us Weekly first reported, Simpson will headline the docu-series, The Price of Beauty, which will follow the singer, 28, as she travels around the world in search of what people find beautiful and why, VH1 announced Monday.\r\n\r\nAsked to do a show about true beauty, Simpson -- who endured much body bullying in January for performing in a pair of unflattering high-waisted jeans -- said she was &quot;immediately intrigued.&quot;\r\n&quot;I have always believed that beauty comes from within and confidence will always make a woman beautiful, but I know how much pressure some women put on themselves to look perfect,&quot; she said in a statement Monday.\r\n\r\n&quot;I am really looking forward to discovering how beauty is perceived in different cultures and participating in some of the crazy things people do to feel beautiful,&quot; she continued. &quot;I know we will all learn a lot on this journey and I am so excited that VH1 is coming along on what I&apos;m sure will be a wild ride.&quot;\r\n\r\nAdded Jeff Olde, EVP, VH1 Original Programming &amp; Production: &quot;Perhaps more than any other pop culture figure on the radar today, Jessica Simpson has been the target of our obsession with beauty on both sides of the equation. She is a woman who can set trends and create firestorms with a single photo. We could not be more thrilled that Jessica now gets to take control of that conversation and take a look at the idea of beauty through her own unique, unfiltered lens. And we at VH1 are excited to be in the passenger seat next to her as she begins this fantastic journey.&quot;\r\n\r\nShooting begins in mid-July, with the show airing sometime next year. Pingel was alone with Fawcett in 2006 when she was first diagnosed with anal cancer.  &quot;I just gave her a huge hug,&quot; he tells Us. &quot;I told her she&apos;ll be fine and wiped away some tears. Farrah just said, &apos;OK, let&apos;s do it. Let&apos;s get this out of me.&apos; She fought really hard.&quot;  Take a look back at the life of Farrah Fawcett Pingel last spoke to the actress at her 62nd birthday party on February 2.  &quot;We went over to her house,&quot; he tells Us. &quot;I made her her favorite German chocolate cake, which her mother had always made. When I was with her, I made it many, many times for her, and she loved it. She actually said that my cake was a little bit better than her mother&apos;s!&quot;  Despite battling cancer, Fawcett was &quot;radiant and wonderful&quot; on her birthday, Pingel says. &quot;She was having such a good time. We all had cake.&quot;  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to other stars who have died too soon\nAll of Fawcett&apos;s close friends were present, including longtime love Ryan O&apos;Neal.  &quot;We just sat around, and we talked about Germany [where the actress underwent alternative medical treatments] and life - everything,&quot; Pingel tells Us. &quot;Farrah and I just gossiped about stuff. We were just having such a wonderful evening. The thing about Farrah is, when you saw her, she was gorgeous. She was absolutely gorgeous every time I saw her.&quot;  &quot;She made me breathless every time,&quot; he continues. &quot;Regardless of what war was raging inside of her, she was beautiful every time I saw her. She had a heart and a fight that kept her going.&quot;  See more of today&apos;s top celeb news photos She was optimistic on her birthday, not thinking it was her last, Pingel  says.  &quot;Farrah was a fighter and she had things she wanted to do still,&quot; adds Pingel, who runs the website charliesangels.com. &quot;She wanted to work. She wanted to get back to work and do more projects.&quot;\nRemember those stars who died last year\nLooking back, Pingel says his happiest times with the actress was making her chocolate chip cookies.  &quot;She loved the way I made them, but she always wanted them burnt,&quot; he recalls. &quot;And I was like, &apos;Farrah, my burnt cookies aren&apos;t great!&apos; But she always wanted me to burn them. She always wanted them crisp. That&apos;s how she loved them and that&apos;s how I made them for her.&quot;  &quot;Even after our working relationship left and it turned into a strong friendship, I still would make her cookies,&quot; he tells Us. &quot;She loved that. Her smile, her laugh, and her voice &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201D; I will always miss. Judge Bruno Tonioli called her performance a cross between &quot;Baby Jane and the bride of Chucky.&quot;  She and her partner Jonathan Roberts received two 7s and an 8, the lowest scores of the night.  &quot;I&apos;m sorry they didn&apos;t like it, but I really didn&apos;t do it for them,&quot; Osmond told Usmagazine.com backstage. &quot;I did it for all the people who have been voting for us, and I have a massive doll base and that&apos;s who I did it for.&quot;  She went on, &quot;I could&apos;ve come out [in] something slinky and sexy, but it&apos;s a family show. I know my audience, so it was really a thank you to them.&quot;  Osmond is brushing off any negativity.  &quot;I think it shows how far I&apos;ve come over the 10 weeks,&quot; she said. &quot;There&apos;s no way I could&apos;ve done that 10 weeks ago!  &quot;It would&apos;ve been nice to [hear], &apos;You&apos;re all ... James -- from the African country.\n&quot;It&apos;s the wee hours of morning in New York, but she is excited at the news,&quot; Madonna&apos;s lawyer Alan Chinula told the Associated Press. &quot;As her lawyer, I am happy that this has settled this contentious issue.&quot;  \nSee pics of more stars who have adopted\nSources at the High Court tell Usmagazine.com that Mercy could be with Madonna as early as next week. &quot;Her passport is already being prepared - we&apos;re not going to pause this over the weekend,&quot; says a senior-level insider.  &quot;Madonna and Mercy should be together by Wednesday [next week].&quot;  \nSee Madonna&apos;s past flings\nMercy is currently being transferred to the Kumbali lodge, which is where Madonna resides while staying in Malawi.  Chinula said he would now turn to arranging a passport for Chifundo, which could take several days. He said he is awaiting word from Madonna on travel plans for the girl.  A lower court had denied Madonna&apos;s bid to adopt in April, claiming she had not spent enough time in the country.  \nSee Madonna&apos;s most scandalous moments\nBut in Friday&apos;s one-hour ruling, Chief Justice Lovemore Munlo praised the Madonna&apos;s commitment to helping disadvantaged children and slammed &quot;old laws&quot; that prevented first adoption attempts.\n&quot;The matter of residence should be determined at the time of application of the adoption,&quot; Chief Justice Lovemore Munlo said. &quot;In this case, Madonna was in Malawi not by chance but by intention. surrogate.\nSee photos of star mugshots.\nMartins Ferry Police Chief Barry Carpenter and Bridgeport Police Chief Chad Dojack were charged with several felonies on Friday, the Associated Press reports. Carpenter, 32, was charged with two counts of burglary, one count of receiving stolen property, one count of theft in office, one count of unauthorized use of property or services and one count of tampering with evidence.\nDojack, 30, was charged with two counts of complicity to burglary and one count of complicity to receiving stolen property. Although Dojack could face up to 14.5 years in prison if convicted on all charges, Carpenter could face up to 21.5 years in jail.\nThe two cops were booked into the Belmont County, Ohio jail at approximately 9 p.m. on Wednesday, the Associated Press reports. The two men -- who posted bond shortly after their arrests and were released -- allegedly planned to dig up information on the woman, named Michelle Ross, who carried the couple&apos;s babies to sell to tabloid photographers.\n&quot;It is extremely troubling that the persons sworn to uphold the law and protect the public are now charged with violating those oaths,&quot; special prosecutor T. Shawn Hervey said, adding that it was troubling that society &quot;is so celebrity crazed that a market exists and tens of thousands of dollars are exchanged for pictures and stories of celebrity scandal.&quot;\nCheck out photos of stars in court.\nThe alleged burglary took place in mid-May in the eastern Ohio town of Martins Ferry, and the allegations against Carpenter and DoJack surfaced about a week later. https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/spencer-pratt-and-kim-kardashian-2009299/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/spencer-pratt-and-kim-kardashian-2009299/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/spencer-pratt-and-kim-kardashian-2009299/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Spencer Pratt: I&#8217;m More Famous Than the Kardashians", "datePublished": "2009-09-29T13:49:32-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T21:00:18-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "He and wife Heidi Montag are \"Barack and Michelle famous,\" he claims", "articleBody": "Kim, Khloe and Kourtney Kardashian have been dominating all the headlines lately.\r\nBut Hills star Spencer Pratt claims he is still more famous than the three reality star sibs.\r\n\r\n&quot;Speidi is Barack and Michelle famous, not Kardashian famous!&quot; Pratt, 26, tells the New York Post, comparing his relationship with wife Heidi Montag to the Obamas.\r\n\r\nHe later added, &quot;The fact that USA Today said we&apos;re the third most famous couple in the world after Brangelina and The Obamas is amazing. I don&apos;t care what people say about me. It&apos;s cool.&quot;\r\nPratt also disses former Hills star Lauren Conrad, whom he says quit the show because &quot;Speidi was getting more famous than her.&quot;\r\n&quot;Her ego ruined her life and her career -- I pray for her every day and we&apos;d all love for her to come back to The Hills when she realizes her move didn&apos;t work,&quot; he says of Conrad, who earned $125,000 per episode (and reportedly stipulated that no other star&apos;s salary could match hers). &quot;She tried to put MTV over a barrel by demanding more money than God.&quot;\r\n\r\nLike Conrad, Audrina Patridge is making a big mistake leaving The Hills, Pratt says. (Patridge has plans for her own reality show.)\r\n&quot;The day she can hold 22 minutes of content with her brain, is the day I&apos;m walking on Mars with no oxygen tank barefoot,&quot; he says. Borat, in which Cohen played a clueless foreigner, made slightly less, $26.5 million.\r\nCheck out more photos of stars being funny.\r\nBut the New York Times points out that, overall, Cohen&apos;s newest comedy opened up weaker as it was released in 2,756 theaters -- three times as many as Borat. (It went on to gross $128.5 million domestically.)\r\nSee pics of stars&apos; dramatic changes for roles.\r\nIce Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs came in second place this weekend with $28.5 million, followed by Megan Fox&apos;s Transformers with $24 million.\r\nRounding out the top 5 was Johnny Depp&apos;s Public Enemies ($14.1 million) and The Proposal ($10.5 million). Rourke received the best actor prize for his role in the sports comeback film, The Wrestler, which was also awarded best picture.   As he did with his Golden Globes acceptance speech, Rourke thanked everyone who helped him get to this point, including his director, Darren Aronofsky, the Santa Monica police department and the wrestling community. He dedicated the award to his dog, Loki, who died Monday.\r\n\r\nLeo later took the stage to collect her prize for Frozen River, which got its start a year ago at the Sundance Film Festival, where it won the top dramatic honor.  The award for best supporting actress went to Cruz for her role as crazed artist in a three-way relationship with Javier Bardem and Scarlett Johansson in Vicky Cristina Barcelona.  \r\n\r\nIn her speech, Cruz thanked filmmaker Woody Allen -- who won the top screenplay honor -- simply for &quot;letting me be around him.  &quot;He&apos;s really the symbol of independence in our industry,&quot; she said at the awards ceremony, which honors movies that cost less than $20 million to make. on Idol", "datePublished": "2009-08-07T13:32:29-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:57:36-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "She says she doesn't feel guilty about sitting in Paula Abdul's chair", "articleBody": "Victoria Beckham doesn&apos;t feel guilty about filling Paula Abdul&apos;s seat at the judges&apos; table during American Idol&apos;s Denver auditions on Friday.\nSee Victoria Beckam&apos;s most outrageous outfits of all time.\n&quot;You know, I don&apos;t,&quot; she told Ryan Seacrest in an interview on his KIIS-FM radio show this morning. &quot;I&apos;m a spiritual person, and I believe you get back what you put out there, and I hope she does something that&apos;s bigger and better, and I hope she&apos;s going to be happy. And she&apos;s great so she&apos;s going to be good at whatever she does.&quot;\nCheck out Paula Abdul&apos;s wacky wardrobe.\nPosh Spice, 35 -- who will appear in one episode of Season 9 -- said she couldn&apos;t turn down the opportunity, which came one day after Abdul announced she wasn&apos;t returning.\n&quot;I am beyond excited!&quot; Beckham said. &quot;When I got the phone call, I just couldn&apos;t believe it. I feel like I got the best job that there is... I&apos;m still grinning from ear to ear, and I&apos;m going to try hard to pout and not shatter the illusion that I&apos;m a moody cow, but I don&apos;t know if I can -- I&apos;m just so happy.&quot;\nSee which Idol contestants have gotten married or have had babies.\nBeckham, who has brought her family -- husband David Beckham and sons Brooklyn, 10, Romeo, 6, and Cruz, 4 -- to watch the show, joked that despite her stoic demeaner, she plans to maintain Abdul&apos;s dynamic as the &quot;really sweet&quot; judge.\n&quot;I want to be nice to people,&quot; she said. &quot;I know how it feels to be stood there and be judged and how it can feel when nerves get the better of you, and I don&apos;t want to shatter anybody&apos;s dream. But at the same time, there&apos;s nothing wrong with a little bit of constructive criticism. It&apos;s doing it nicely, because even those that are bad, they don&apos;t know that they&apos;re bad and who am I to shatter that?&quot;  \nSee photos of Idol&apos;s most memorable contestants.\nShe is also anxious to sit alongside Simon Cowell.  &quot;He is the only man in the music industry who turned down the Spice Girls and said, &apos;We would never work,&apos;&quot; she revealed. &quot;But I have so much respect for him... I like the fact that he&apos;s honest. I think he&apos;s very funny. He has a very tongue-in-cheek British sense of humor, which I have to, so I&apos;m looking forward to a little bit of banter. Take an ensemble like Friends. They felt the same way about each other, even though some became more famous than others and some were more liked. Host Foxx then walked on stage dressed as an 80s era Jackson - complete with the gloves - as &quot;Beat It&quot; blared in the background. He then showed off some of Jackson&apos;s signature moves, including Jackson&apos;s infamous crotch-grabbing routine.  He then shouted for the audience to clap their hands. &quot;C&apos;mon,&quot; he yelled, &quot;for Michael.&quot;\r\n\r\n&quot;We are here for the greatest. There&apos;s no need to be sad,&quot; he told the audience, which included Diddy, Alicia Keys and Kanye West, among others. &quot;We want to celebrate this black man - he belongs to us - and we shared him with everybody else.&quot;  &quot;It don&apos;t matter what he looked like ... what his nose looked like ... it was what he sounded like,&quot; he went on.  &quot;Who was the best?&quot; Foxx then asked the audience. The crowd shouted,&quot;MIchael!&quot;\r\n\r\nFoxx recounted seeing Jackson in concert in 1983 at Texas Stadium.  &quot;Mike comes out ... and grown white men fainted,&quot; said Foxx.\r\n\r\nHe then did the moonwalk across the stage to honor the singer, who died Thursday at the age of 50 after suffering cardiac arrest.  &quot;I am going to moonwalk for Michael Jackson,&quot; Foxx told the crowd. Jolie said in an interview with Ann Curry that aired on the Today show this morning. &quot;I would have been less self-destructive.&quot;\nSee Angelina Jolie&apos;s baby photo\nJolie says she wants her and Brad Pitt&apos;s children to benefit like she never did from visiting refugee camps in Afghanistan and Pakistan. Maddox, 8,  has already been to one, she says.\n&quot;I want them to see it as an area where they can go down the street and play football with those kids and get to know them and, as they grow up, see them as friends they spend time with,&quot; Jolie said.\nCheck out adorable photos of Brad and Angelina&apos;s kids\n&quot;I hope if I raise them with a more accurate view of the world than I was raised with, then they will naturally be better people. And I&apos;m sure my children will be visiting and learning from refugees in the future,&quot; she continued.\nJolie says she relates to female refugees.  &quot;I&apos;ve talked with these women and they were like any girlfriends I&apos;ve ever talked to,&quot; she told Curry. &quot;They were just sweet and funny and kind and great mommies. It taught me a lot about a strength of character that I&apos;ve found in many, many refugees that I&apos;ve met and continue to meet.&quot;  \nSee photos of Angelina Jolie doing charity work around the world\n&quot;And I think about my kids. And I think, God, on a daily basis, for them to go days and days and not have anything to give your children has got to be the most difficult thing as a mother,&quot; she went on.\nShe doesn&apos;t plan on giving up her charity work any time soon.  &quot;See yourself as an old woman doing it?&quot; Curry asked.  Jolie replied: &quot;I hope so.&quot;\nCurry -- who ended up hosting an event for World Refugee Day with Jolie Thursday after Anderson Cooper&apos;s plane was delayed -- joked that Jolie still looked Lambert was angry when he learned that the label teamed up with Hi Fi Recordings to release an 11-track album, On With the Show, featuring his early works later this summer.\n&quot;The work I did back then in no way reflects the music I am currently in the studio working on,&quot; Idol producer 19 Entertainment said in a statement this week on behalf of Lambert.\nFind out where your favorite Idol contestants are now\nBut a Hi Fi Recordings rep tells Usmagazine.com exclusively:  &quot;Adam is now enjoying the success that he and Wilshire Records hoped for. However, he is now represented by high-profile companies who released a statement in Adam&apos;s name saying the songs on On With the Show were recorded four years ago and Adam only contributed vocals. This is simply not true.\n&quot;The songs were recorded in a professional recording studio with top notch musicians and producers since the music was always meant to be released. Of the 11 songs that will appear on the album, On With the Show, Adam co-wrote eight with Monte Pittman (Madonna&apos;s guitar player).  \nSee photos of more sexy singers at the CMT Awards this month\n&quot;As co-writer and performer, Adam will receive significant royalties just as any superstar artist would. He has the chance, finally, to make a fortune for his work -- definitely more with this album than through a major label deal.\n&quot;This pre-Idol work is a fantastic representation of who Adam is and what inspired him during the months before he became famous. We intend to see that Adam will still benefit from the success of &apos;Want&apos; (on iTunes now), and from the sale of On With the Show, even though he is now part of a major franchise that only I just was so impressed by his sweetness,&quot; Shields tells Rolling Stone&apos;s special commemorative issue on the King of Pop, on stands Friday.\r\nRemember Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\r\n&quot;He was thoughtful, sensitive, sweet, and had a funny sense of humor,&quot; she goes on. &quot;If you got to talk to him about music or about the future of technology, his voice would get deeper, he would start talking, and it was as if he was this genius.&quot;\r\nSexuality didn&apos;t play a role in their relationship, she explains.\r\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years.\r\n&quot;As he grew older and the more he started to change physically, the more asexual he became to me,&quot; Shields says. &quot;It was easy for him to be a friend to me, because I was the most celebrated virgin ever; it&apos;s ridiculous, but I was America&apos;s virgin.\r\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life in photos.\r\n&quot;You saw women who were more sexual, who wanted to throw themselves at him and feel like they were going to teach him; we just found each other, and we didn&apos;t have to deal with our sexuality. As I grew up and started having boyfriends, I would share with him, and he was like a little kid who talked about the bases- what first base was, what second base was, and it sounded very odd to the outside, I can imagine, but to the inside, to someone who&apos;s never really left his bubble, you can understand how he would be curious.&quot; Shields continues.\r\nSee photos of Michael Jackson with his kids.\r\n&quot;There were times when he would ask me to marry him, and I would say, &apos;You have me for the rest of your life, you don&apos;t need to marry me, I&apos;m going to go on and do my own life and have my own marriage and my own kids, and you&apos;ll always have me.&apos; I think it made him relax. He didn&apos;t want to lose things that meant something to him,&quot; she adds.\r\nShe last saw Jackson at Elizabeth Taylor&apos;s 1991 wedding.\r\n&quot;He seemed like his own funny self,&quot; she says. &quot;We snuck in and took pictures of ourselves next to her dress. We always seemed to revert to being little kids. She went on to star in his movie Pretty in Pink.\n&quot;I was stunned and incredibly sad to hear about the death of John Hughes,&quot; Ringwald told Usmagazine.com in a statement. &quot;He was and will always be such an important part of my life. Home Alone movies, which made Macaulay Culkin a star.\n&quot;I was a fan of both his work and a fan of him as a person,&quot; Culkin tells Us in a statement. &quot;The world has lost not only a quintessential filmmaker whose influence will be felt for generations, but a great and decent man.&quot;  \nSteve Martin, who starred in Hughes&apos; 1987 film Planes, Trains &amp; Automobiles alongside the late John Candy, told Us the late director was an even better writer.\n&quot;John Hughes was a great director, but his gift was in screenwriting,&quot; Martin told Us in a statement. According to Tanczos, Jon just wanted to come in &quot;to have a beer and chill.&quot; He was standing around talking to the women -- one was middle-aged and one who looked to be in her 20s or 30s -- when he noticed a few people taking photos. He turned his back to the cameras.   &quot;People weren&apos;t causing a scene or ooohing and ahhhing, but Jon could tell people were starting to notice him and he got uncomfortable,&quot; Tanczos says.\r\n\r\nJon, who only stayed at the bar for 30 minutes that afternoon, finished his first beer and left, Tanczos tells Us.  A woman named Jess called into 104.7 The Dial radio station after spotting Jon at the Front Street tiki bar.  &quot;They were just ... drinking some Miller Lites,&quot; Jess said on the air. &quot;No canoodaling, nothing like that. He was wearing his ring, I will give him that.&quot;\r\n\r\n Jon, who reportedly was in upstate New York to visit TLC&apos;s American Chopper store, took his two friends to Torches restaurant after their beer.  &quot;There was no flirting or affection,&quot; Torches manager Damien Brady tells Us. &quot;They just looked like old friends and were laughing and having a good time.&quot;  The three had dinner -- Brady believes Jon paid -- and stayed at the restaurant for more than an hour. Black Eyed Peas&apos; will.i.am was among the guests. (Around 5:09 p.m., attendees were overheard saying that the two had wed; cheers were also heard outside the estate.)\n&quot;It&apos;s official! Fergie and Josh tied the knot tonight in Malibu,&quot; her manager tells Us. &quot;The Black Eyed Peas were all there. The ceremony was incredible! And they&apos;re still partying!&quot;\nLook back at Fergie&apos;s weight ups and downs leading up to her wedding.\nFergie, 33, wore a fitted, white ruched, corseted wedding gown with a mesh tulle overlay, spaghetti straps and a long train designed by Dolce &amp; Gabbana. The singer was draped in millions of dollars worth of one-of-a-kind diamonds by H.Stern.  Duhamel, 36, also wore Dolce &amp; Gabbana, as did the bridesmaids (in black dresses) and groomsmen (in black suits and white ties).  The two exchanged H.Stern rings, with each band engraved with special personal messages by the bride and groom. Her engagement ring had a round, 4-carat brilliant cut diamond set amid other diamonds, with colors ranging from white to cognac. A narrow colored diamond wedding band was designed to match. Duhamel&apos;s ring was made of 18K white gold with a brush finish.\nSee unforgettable celeb wedding photos.\nThe singer (real name: Stacy Ferguson), and Duhamel have been dating since 2004 after Duhamel confessed to In Style that she was his celeb crush.\n&quot;I had read in a magazine that he had a naughty dream about me,&quot; Fergie told Playboy last year. &quot;All my friends knew about him because he had been a soap opera star. I&apos;m not into soap operas, but they told me, &apos;You gotta go out with him. Do it for the group. Take one for the team.&apos;\nSee photos of other stars who landed their crushes.\n&quot;Time went by, and I saw on the schedule that we were taping a show called Las Vegas, and I thought, &apos;Is this the show he&apos;s on?&apos;&quot; she went on. &quot;We met, and I said, &apos;I read you had a dream about me.&apos; He said yeah, and I asked, &apos;Was it good?&apos; He said it was. So we hit it off.&quot;\nHe popped the question in late 2007.\nOf wedding plans, Fergie told USA Today, &quot;I have a big stack of wedding magazines, and I&apos;ve never picked one up before in my life.&quot;  \nFind out at what ages your favorite stars got engaged.\nDuhamel recently told Entertainment Tonight that plans were &quot;all going great. It&apos;s fun, actually. We&apos;re both really excited about it, and it will be good.&quot;\nLast month, Fergie told Blender married life won&apos;t be so different for them.\n&quot;We&apos;re practically married, anyway,&quot; she said. &quot;I&apos;m madly in love with him. (The interview was not broadcast.)\nIn his will (released Wednesday) Jackson -- who died at age 50 after suffering cardiac arrest June 25 --  named his mother Katherine as guardian of his three children -- Prince, Paris and 7-year-old Blanket. (If Katherine died before him or couldn&apos;t serve as guardian, Jackson nominated Diana Ross, according to Jackson&apos;s will.)  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nLast week, Katherine filed a petition in Los Angeles Probate Court seeking legal guardianship of the children. (In her 22-page petition, she claims the children &quot;have no relationship with their biological mother.&quot;)\nA guardianship hearing scheduled for Monday has been postponed until July 13 at the request of attorneys for Rowe and Katherine Jackson.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nBut on Thursday, Rowe told NBC&apos;s Henry that she would seek a restraining order to keep Jackson&apos;s father, Joe Jackson, away from the children.\nRowe also said she was willing to submit to any testing, including DNA to prove that she is the children&apos;s true biological mother. She said she would submit to psychological testing.\nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\n&quot;I am stepping up,&quot; Rowe said. &quot;I have to.&quot;\nRowe wed Jackson in 1996 (he was a patient in the dermatologist&apos;s office, where she worked as a nurse). The children were born through artificial insemination. (The new issue of Us Weekly exclusively reports that the children&apos;s father is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist and Rowe&apos;s former boss.)\nAfter Jackson and Rowe divorced in 1999, she agreed to give up her parental rights, insisting Jackson was a good father.\nSince their father&apos;s passing, the kids have been with the Jackson family and &quot;are happy,&quot; Jackson patriarch Joe said at a press conference Monday. They&apos;re with &quot;other young ones in the Jackson family.... A rep for Copperfield tells Usmagazine.com.  &quot;During an illusion where David attempts to walk through the rotating blades of a 12-foot high industrial fan, the fan and its platform were being rotated by one of David&apos;s illusion technicians,&quot; the rep says. &quot;Just prior to David himself walking through the fan, [the assistant] was accidentally pulled into the vortex of the moving fan blades, causing injury to his arm and face.&quot;  The Clark County Fire Department confirms that they received a call at 11:25 p.m. from the theater.  &quot;It was reported that someone&apos;s arm was stuck in a fan prop,&quot; Scott Allison, the fire department&apos;s spokesperson, tells Us.When paramedics arrived, the assistant&apos;s arm was free and had suffered severe bleeding.   The assistant, named Brandon (his last name is withheld for his privacy), broke his arm in multiple places.   &quot;The surgery was several hours wherein the doctors could insert pins and bolts,&quot; the rep says. &quot;There was a puncture on his face requiring eight or nine stitches.  The Copperfield crew waited at the hospital during his arm and face surgery.&quot;\r\nTake a look at reality stars who are cursed.\r\nCopperfield was there when he woke up and presented him with a children&apos;s magic set to practice on during his recovery, his rep says.  &quot;Brandon is a fantastic guy that has been with our team almost a year and is a loyal and hard-working illusion technician that is truly loved by all who know him,&quot; Copperfield tells Us. &quot;If he gets too good with the magic set, I&apos;m in big trouble!&quot;  An eyewitness to the incident tells Us that when it happened, the audience &quot;heard a thump.&quot;  The eyewitness adds: &quot;One of the assistants dropped to the floor. The curtain came down partially. Blood was everywhere, and the other assistants dragged the victim back. Then the curtain closed all the way.&quot;  Shortly after, &quot;Copperfield came out and said, &apos;We have an emergency and we might have to end the show...please give me two minutes.&apos; He came back a minute later and said, &apos;I&apos;m sorry, the show is over...if you want your money back, refunds will be given,&quot; says the audience member.So You Think You Can Dance judge Mary Murphy -- who happened to be in the audience that night -- calls the moment &quot;shocking.&quot; &#xA0;\r\nCheck out photos of two other famous Davids performing.\r\n&#xA0;\r\n&quot;Everyone around me thought it was a joke; part of the show,&quot; she tells Us. &quot;But from my vantage point I could see clearly how serious it was. I pray that he is all right.&quot;\r\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos.\r\nAccording to Copperfield&apos;s rep, Brandon is still in the hospital.  But the show will go on. The hotel source tells Us: &quot;From what I&apos;ve been told, David still intends to do both his shows this evening, as scheduled.&quot;  &quot;The show will go on thanks to David&apos;s amazing, hard-working crew, after rehearsing all day to fill in for Brandon,&quot; Copperfield&apos;s rep says. &quot;Many people assume that the death-defying illusions I do on stage are not dangerous,&quot; Copperfield tells Us. &quot;This unfortunate accident shows that couldn&apos;t be further from the truth, and we&apos;re just thankful that Brandon&apos;s injuries weren&apos;t worse. An MGM spokesperson had no comment. (She said she didn&apos;t want her first meeting with her granddaughter to be caught on camera.)\nTake a peek at Tori and husband Dean McDermott&apos;s family photo album\nThe finale of Tori &amp; Dean: Home Sweet Hollywood captured all the drama - and Candy isn&apos;t happy. The same old whining gets tired after a while,&quot; Candy writes. &quot;Enough complaining about what may or may not have happened during first grade or YMCA camp, or what vegetable you were forced to endure, especially when you are privileged enough to be on TV and get paid for it... Life isn&apos;t just a show. (It was also the most-watched show among women 18-49 and persons 18-49.)  In comparison, the show&apos;s season 5 debut on Memorial Day attracted 9.8 million watchers.\r\n\r\nOn Tuesday, the network announced it has halted production of the show until August to give the family &quot;some time off to regroup.&quot; (A retrospective of the Gosselins&apos; 10 years of marriage airs June 29.)\r\n\r\nExperts are split whether the show can survive.  Marc Berman, senior television editor at Mediaweek, tells Usmagazine.com: &quot;Once all of this dies down and Jon and Kate aren&apos;t in the news anymore, this could be a problem for the show. They divorce, they move on with their lives and so do the viewers.&quot;  \r\n\r\nRobert J. Thompson, founding director of the Bleier Center for Television and Popular Culture at Syracuse University, says the show has lost its identity.\r\n&quot;It&apos;s like if The Cosby Show, mid-season, suddenly became Married With Children,&quot; he tells Us. &quot;I would not want to bet what&apos;s left of my retirement fund on the ongoing success of this show.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": that are ineffective and dangerous.\r\nAmong the Winfrey guests who have offered questionable medical advice:  * Suzanne Somers: She told Winfrey she swallows 60 supplements every day and takes a variety of bioidentical hormones to fight aging.  * Jenny McCarthy: Declaring that vaccinations caused her child&apos;s autism, the actress supported a Winfrey guest who said she wouldn&apos;t get her own kid vaccinated.  * Physician/author Christiane Northrup: She told Winfrey viewers that &quot;in many women, thyroid dysfunction develops because of an energy blockage in the throat region, the result of a lifetime of &apos;swallowing&apos; words one is aching to say.&quot;\r\nSee how Oprah&apos;s body has changed over the years\r\nWinfrey insists she is only trying to open dialogue between her viewers and their doctors.  &quot;For 23 years, my show has presented thousands of topics that reflect the human experience, including doctors&apos; medical advice and personal health stories that have prompted conversations between our audience members and their health care providers,&quot; Winfrey says in a statement. &quot;I trust the viewers, and I know that they are smart and discerning enough to seek out medical opinions to determine what may be best for them.&quot;\r\nSee photos of Oprah Winfrey and other stars who have survived abuse\r\nBut some Winfrey viewers say they have a hard time not taking the daytime diva&apos;s information to heart.  Living Oprah, a blogger who spent an entire year following &quot;the advice of Oprah Winfrey,&quot; said she &quot;had mixed results from the health guidance I learned on Oprah&apos;s show and there were a couple items that conflicted with my own doctor&apos;s guidance. My doc always shrugged at how many supplements I knocked back in 2008, for instance.&quot;\r\n\r\nBiologist PZ Myers, an associate professor at the University of Minnesota, also blogged: &quot;It&apos;s about time one of the big media players pointed out that she is promoting dangerous fake therapies ... all with a happy smile, of course, and a message of positive self-esteem for women. Fergie (who turned 33) and Tarantino (who turned 45) caught the 7 p.m. performance of Cirque du Soleil&apos;s Beatle-themed show &quot;LOVE.&quot; (They devoured cupcakes backstage, says a source.)   They then partied into the early morning hours at club Jet with Fergie&apos;s fiance&#xA0;Josh Duhamel,  Daryl Hannah,   and rapper Nelly.   (Guest Kid Rock bought The Dutchess a hot dog toaster called the Hot Diggity Dog. &quot;You put the bun on one side, and you put the hot dog in the little hot dog holes, and it pops out of the toaster in about a minute, and your hot dogs are ready to go,&quot; Fergie told Us.)  Further putting those pregnancy rumors to rest, Fergie sipped on wine throughout the night.   At 2:30 a.m. at Jet, Fergie and Tarantino were presented with a birthday cake.    Tarantino &quot;grabbed a handful&quot; and threw it at Fergie, an eyewitness told Usmagazine.com. She then tossed a piece right back at him before &quot;laughing and hugging him and heading back for the Mirage Villas, where they were staying,&quot; the onlooker adds. "articleBody": "Tom Cruise isn&apos;t the only actor who frowns upon the use of anti-depressant drugs.\r\nOn Monday&apos;s Larry King Live, Jim Carrey -- who has battled depression since he was a child -- warned people about using Prozac for a long period of time.\r\n&quot;At the risk of like opening up the whole Tom Cruise Prozac argument, you know, I don&apos;t disagree in many ways,&quot; Carrey said. &quot;I think Prozac and things like that are very valuable to people for short periods of time. But I believe if you&apos;re on them for an extended period of time, you never get to the problem.\r\n&quot;You never get to see what the problem is, because everything is just kind of OK,&quot; he said. &quot;And so, you don&apos;t deal. And people deal when they get desperate.&quot;  Carrey&apos;s solution: &quot;Supplements,&quot; he said.  &quot;It is vitamins. But it&apos;s also certain elements of the brain like Tyrosine and hydroxytryptophan that they&apos;re treating depression with now,&quot; he said. &quot;It is a natural substance that&apos;s in your brain. Instead of being a Serotonin inhibitor, which just uses the serotonin you have and Prozac and things like that. it just uses the Serotonin you have and it doesn&apos;t allow it go back into the receptor. It metabolizes your serotonin after a while and you have to keep taking more and more to feel good. This actually creates dopamine and creates serotonin,&quot; Carrey continued. &quot;It&apos;s a wonderful thing. It&apos;s amazing. I&apos;m going to talk a lot about it in the near future.&quot;\r\nCarrey said his girlfriend Jenny McCarthy also helps him. He added: &quot;After hearing of the malicious allegations, Linda immediately made arrangements to take the test first thing Monday, which was analyzed at LapCorp labs in Florida.&quot;  How did Linda -- whose daughter told celeb blogger Perez Hilton that people &quot;have told&quot; her that her mother does drugs -- fare with the test?\nTake a look at more reality show catfights.\n &quot;Linda Hogan is clean, clean, clean,&quot; Smith said. &quot;She tested negative for everything including Amphetamine (speed), Cannabinoid (marijuana), Cocaine (coke), Opiates (vicodin, morphine, heroin) and Phencyclidine(PCP).&quot;  Still, in the in the new issue of Us Weekly (on newsstands now), Brooke says that although she hasn&apos;t witnessed her mother using, she believes she does.   &quot;I have heard from a lot of close friends -- I mean, a lot of people -- that she does,&quot; the star, 20, told Us. &quot;She has completely changed. She was always hard on me about being a good girl. For her to be so tough on me and then be this crazy-ass wild child... I just don&apos;t know who she ever really was.&quot;  In the statement to Usmagazine.com from Smith, he added:   &quot;Linda also had a full medical exam. According to the doctors who examined her, she has even had gains in bone density and muscle mass since her last physical, which indicates a healthy lifestyle. This further disproves Hulk&apos;s and Brooke&apos;s unfounded and hurtfull allegations. Linda&apos;s drug screening shows she has no trace of any drugs in her system, legal or illegal, that includes prescription medication. Linda does not do drugs and never accused her daughter of doing drugs either.\nHulk is the expert on drug use. He admits in his Rolling Stone article last month about his 30 years of abusing cocaine, marijuana and pills. Now that the truth is in black and white, all Linda wants is an apology from both of them.   &quot;This has been a very vindictive and hurtful attempt to discredit Linda. She has opened her private medical records to disprove Brooke and Hulk&apos;s horrendous, unsupported allegations. She asks the public respect her privacy on this matter so she may begin to repair her relationship with her daughter.&quot;\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nBut after Linda -- through her rep -- called her daughter a liar, Brooke told Us that she isn&apos;t sure if she will be able to reconcile their relationship.  &quot;I actually dialed her phone... but she didn&apos;t answer,&quot; Brooke said. &quot;I love her no matter what. I&apos;ll forgive her and I&apos;ll pray for her, but I don&apos;t think I can be around her anymore. Ever. She may as well have disowned me. Host: As Much As You Love Jesus, You&#8217;ve Got to Drink Water!", "datePublished": "2009-06-10T15:51:06-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:34-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Plus, find out what \"banned\" luxury item new cast member Holly Montag tried to bring into the jungle", "articleBody": "It might have seemed like a ratings ploy when Spencer and Heidi Pratt were allowed back into the Costa Rican jungle on NBC&apos;s I&apos;m a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!, but the show&apos;s host, Damien Fahey, assures Usmagazine.com the pair had to fight to get back in the game.\nBefore departing the jungle after one episode, the couple &quot;threw a big fit and made a lot of people&apos;s lives difficult,&quot; Fahey tells Us. &quot;We didn&apos;t think it was fair [for them] to leave and then just be let back in. Initially NBC said no, then no again, and after the fourth no, Spencer and Heidi really started to beg and plead to come back.&quot;\nNow that the pair has left Costa Rica for good following Heidi&apos;s weekend hospitalization, Fahey reflects on their time in the jungle with Us -- and previews new cast member Holly Montag&apos;s first episode, airing tonight on NBC.  \nFirst off, what do you make of the various reports that Spencer and Heidi were &quot;tortured&quot; in the Lost Chamber? The reality of this show is that these celebrities are really in the jungle. Spencer and Heidi threw a big fit -- made a lot of people&apos;s lives difficult, left, and then wanted back in. We didn&apos;t think it was fair. They really had to prove [their worth], so they stayed in this old decrepit garden shed with spiders and snakes in tanks and all sorts of bugs, but to be honest, it was probably a more comfortable night&apos;s stay -- physically -- than the rest of the camp. It was more of a mind game.\nWere they given food and water? Heidi and Spencer were given the same amount of rations as the others -- a portion of rice about the size of a small fist -- and water. Food, water, medical attention, they were all taken care of. I think they [just had] a breakdown. They&apos;re not used to living like this. Apparently [now] there&apos;s a lawsuit, and [Spencer&apos;s] going to sue...that just seems like a lot of nonsense.     \nSee the most controversial reality stars of all time! \nTheir return to camp was met with mixed reviews. Were their make-good efforts genuine? Stephen Baldwin said he thought their redemption was genuine and Daniel Baldwin called them &quot;convenient Christians.&quot; I tend to side more with Daniel, though they haven&apos;t done anything to disprove Stephen so far. Seemingly they have found Jesus and I think Spencer&apos;s made an incredible transformation, but it&apos;s a work in progress. I do agree with Daniel, though: if you&apos;re going to be Christian and have all these beliefs, you really have to live your life accordingly, especially when you get preachy.\nSee Heidi and Spencer&apos;s wedding photos. \nHave you heard how Heidi is doing now that she&apos;s received medical attention for a gastric ulcer? As much as they drove me crazy, I obviously hope Heidi&apos;s health is better and that Spencer&apos;s okay, too. I haven&apos;t heard how she&apos;s doing -- we&apos;re focused on the shows at hand -- but you saw on the show how they fasted. They were born-again and they started fasting, and when you&apos;re out in the rain forest in 100-degree heat, it doesn&apos;t matter how much you believe in Jesus, you have to drink water!\nAre they really that religious off-camera? Oh yeah, everything is &quot;Jesus.&quot; I didn&apos;t think a lot of it would make it into the show, just because I know religion is a hot topic. But it did, and it&apos;s &apos;praise Jesus&apos; and this and that. Nothing wrong with that, but it just seemed a little contrived.\nCheck out other religious stars.\nTonight&apos;s episode documents Heidi&apos;s sister Holly&apos;s trip into the jungle. How does she stack up to the competition? She&apos;s the polar opposite of everything we&apos;ve seen with her sister. Very sweet, very nice. She&apos;s in it to win it and that&apos;s a great attitude to have. Some of the cast members were surprised she was taking part -- most didn&apos;t know who she was. I think Stephen Baldwin did a nice job of asking, &quot;Oh, what work do you do?&quot; And she didn&apos;t freak out or be like, &apos;You should know who I am.&apos; Holly doesn&apos;t pretend to be anyone she&apos;s not. And she&apos;s really competitive!\nWhat did she bring for her luxury item? Holly was going to bring BlowPop lollipops in -- but they&apos;re banned from camp- so she brought baby powder.   \nNot a bottle of Heidi&apos;s dry shampoo? No! The third installment of the comedy will center on the British publishing exec&apos;s attempts to have a baby before it&apos;s too late.\r\nSee how closely these stars resemble the real-life people they play on the big screen\r\nZellweger, who won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar for Cold Mountain, was  nominated for 2001&apos;s Bridget Jones&apos;s Diary and also starred in the 2004 sequel, Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason.  For the roles, Zellweger famously had to pack on about 30 lbs.\r\nSee stars who have gained weight for movie roles\r\n&quot;Can I just tell you my body is whacked by the time we finish one of those?&quot; she told the British Daily Mail of gaining weight for the films. &quot;It doesn&apos;t know what has happened because it thinks there&apos;s supposed to be a baby and there&apos;s no christening.&quot;  Overeating was fun at first, she said.  &quot;For two days it&apos;s bliss...&quot; she told the paper. &quot;Then after a week your glucose levels are going crazy. You&apos;re up and down and all over the place. It doesn&apos;t feel good, and no one wants to hear that, but it&apos;s the truth.&quot;\r\nSee Us&apos; Weight Winners of 2008!\r\nTrying to shed the weight wasn&apos;t fun, either.  Said the actress, &quot;It was horrible. On one side it&apos;s fantastic because you get to go back to taking care of yourself, so you feel wonderful, but the first lap around the track I felt like I had a toddler on my back.&quot;", And then I played it for Miley, and we realized that if we changed the lyrics a bit, we could make it more of our story, kind of share that side of us, and it could be great,&quot; he told Twist magazine.  \r\n\r\n&quot;So we did. She came in and she and I sat down at the piano and just worked on lyrics a bit, tweaked it up, and it turned out great!&quot; he added.\r\n\r\nThe pair dated for about two years before calling it quits in late 2007. It seemed to have a history, and the buildings are years and years and years old. Here in the United States an old building is about 17 (years old), and over there it&apos;s from 500 B.C., it&apos;s incredible,&quot; she tells the Associated Press.  &quot;Also, the way people live over there. They seem to enjoy life a little bit more,&quot; she continued. &quot;They aren&apos;t running around as much as in New York. They enjoy time with the family. They don&apos;t always have their BlackBerry on.&quot;  \nSee Gwyneth Paltrow&apos;s fashion hits and misses\n(It&apos;s not the first time she&apos;s praised another country. In 2006, she stirred controversy for telling a Portuguese paper that she liked &quot;the English lifestyle&quot; because &quot;it&apos;s not as capitalistic as America. People don&apos;t talk about work and money... they talk about interesting things at dinner.&quot; She later said she was misquoted.)  \nSee what Gwyneth Paltrow looked like the first time she walked a red carpet\nPaltrow - who shot the PBS show Spain ... on the Road Again with chef Mario Batali - says she visits Spain at least once a year and remains close to the family she lived with. She calls them &quot;my Spanish mother&quot; and &quot;my brothers.&quot;\nSee who Gwyneth Paltrow and other stars dated in the 90s\nShe also says that she makes sure her children can speak Spanish.\nSays the actress (who took her first trip to Spain as a teen), &quot;Moses speaks  a little bit, but understands everything. Apple speaks a lot.&quot;\nSee stars who need to give their kids haircuts\nPaltrow says she is also writing a book on U.S. cuisine with Spanish influence that is due out next year.  &quot; ... We&apos;re concentrating on our first child and seeing where things go from there.&quot;)\nThe baby&apos;s birth won&apos;t be captured by reality TV cameras. Roll Hall of Fame Anniversary Shows", "datePublished": "2009-07-22T15:14:41-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:57:02-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The music legends will headline an A-list roster for two shows to tout the venue's 25th anniversary in October", "articleBody": "Music&apos;s biggest stars are set to perform at two New York City concerts this fall to celebrate the Rock n&apos; Roll Hall of Fame&apos;s 25th anniversary.   \r\nBruce Springsteen, U2, Metallica and Stevie Wonder are among the industry greats on the initial roster for the Oct. 29 and Oct. 30 shows, the Hall of Fame announced in a statement Wednesday. The shows, held at New York City&apos;s Madison Square Garden, will feature different set lists and performers each night.\r\nSee some of Hollywood&apos;s hottest rockstar romances!\r\n&quot;Twenty-five years ago a group led by legendary Atlantic Records founder Ahmet Ertegun created this foundation to recognize and celebrate the music and careers of artists whose music helped shape and define our generation,&quot; Jann Wenner, the Founder and Chairman of Rolling Stone and Chairman of the Rock n&apos; Roll Hall of Fame Foundation said in the statement. &quot;These once-in-a-lifetime concerts are designed to celebrate the artists and their music.&quot;\r\nThe artists will take to the stage to play their own music and the music that inspires them, and all proceeds from ticket sales will go to create a permanent endowment for the Rock n&apos; Roll Hall of Fame Foundation and Museum.\r\nCheck out the day&apos;s top celeb news photos.\r\nLocated in Cleveland, Ohio, the Rock n&apos; Roll Hall of Fame and Museum opened in 1983, with Elvis Presley, Little Richard and Ray Charles among its first inductees. suggestion\"", "articleBody": "Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour had quite the request for Oprah Winfrey.\nWintour had told the talk show host to drop 20 pounds to be on the cover of the fashion magazine back in 1998, the editor revealed during an unaired segment from her 60 Minutes interview on Sunday.  \nLook back on Oprah&apos;s weight ups and downs.\n&quot;It was a very gentle suggestion,&quot; she said, laughing. &quot;I went to Chicago to visit Oprah, and I suggested that it might be an idea that she lose a little bit of weight.&quot;  She added: &quot;I said simply that you might feel more comfortable. She was a trooper!&quot;  \nFind out what your favorite fashion models are up to now.\nWinfrey, 55, must have listened to the fashion legend. She was featured on the cover from more than 10 years ago with the tagline: &quot;Oprah! A Major Movie, An Amazing Makeover.&quot;\n&quot;She totally welcomed the idea, and she went on a very stringent diet,&quot; Wintour said. &quot;And it was one of our most successful covers ever.&quot;\nIn the 60 Minutes interview, Wintour, 59, also defended the use of Photoshop to make people &quot;look their best.&quot;\n&quot;That&apos;s one of the things that makes me rather angry, that I don&apos;t understand,&quot; she said. &quot;That if you look wonderful, does that make you less important? Less powerful? Less serious?&quot;\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nAlthough Vogue typically only covers stick-thin models within its pages, she said her magazine maintains an awareness of obesity.\n&quot;I&apos;d just been on a trip to Minnesota, where I can only kindly describe most of the people I saw as little houses,&quot; Wintour said. &quot;There&apos;s such an epidemic of obesity in the United States, and for some reason, everybody focuses on anorexia.&quot;\nWintour, who commissioned a feature on the topic complete with illustrations, said that it was an important issue.\n&quot;We need to spend money time and education on teaching people to eat, exercise and take care of themselves in a healthier way,&quot; she said. &quot;It [has gotten people] provoked, which He said it was &quot;very touching&quot; and that there was &quot;a lot of crying.&quot;\r\n\r\n&quot;We&apos;ll never see his like again,&quot; Stein told reporters after the service. &quot;He was the Wordsworth of the suburban America post-war generation. He was a great, great, great genius and as much of a friend and a great family man as he was a poet.&quot;   After the service, mourners gathered in a procession to a Lake Forest cemetery, where Hughes was to be laid to rest.\r\n\r\nHughes, known for such 80s teen classics as Sixteen Candles and The Breakfast Club, died of a heart attack Aug. 6. He was 59.  He is survived by his wife of 39 years, Nancy, two sons, John and James, and four grandchildren.   Molly Ringwald, who became a star after appearing in 1984&apos;s Sixteen Candles, said she &quot;was stunned and incredibly sad to hear about the death of John Hughes.&quot;\r\n&quot;He will be missed,&quot; by me and by everyone that he has touched,&quot; she added in a statement shortly after his death. &quot;My heart and all my thoughts are with his family now.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id":
